postTitle: HR Business Partner - GTM at Fingerprint
jobTitle: HR Business Partner - GTM at Fingerprint
descContent:
**Fingerprint** empowers developers to stop online fraud at the source.

We work on turning radical new ideas in the fraud detection space into
reality. Our products are developer-focused and our clients range from solo
developers to publicly traded companies. **We are a globally dispersed, 100%
remote company** with a strong open-source focus. Our flagship open-source

We are looking for a strategic HR Business Partner to support our Revenue and
Marketing organizations during a period of fast scaling and operational
maturation. This is not a reactive HR generalist role, it is an embedded
partner to leadership, helping shape org design, elevate manager capability,
and proactively address performance and communication. You will work closely
with the VP of Sales, VP of Marketing, and senior managers to drive clarity,
accountability, and leadership maturity at scale.

### **What Youâ€™ll Own**

**Strategic Partnership**

  * Provide thought partnership to Revenue & Marketing leaders on scaling, org structure, role clarity, and team effectiveness
  * Identify talent gaps, succession risks, and opportunities to level-up leadership behaviors

**Manager Effectiveness & Leadership Coaching**

  * Coach Sales, Customer Success, Sales Engineering and Marketing managers on feedback, difficult conversations, performance management, and decision-making
  * Build leadership capability using Fingerprintâ€™s Leadership Rubric

**Org & Team Health**

  * Diagnose team dynamics, alignment issues, and friction points; drive interventions that improve execution and trust
  * Enable high-quality communication and collaboration across teams

**Performance & Talent**

  * Lead calibration cycles, talent assessments, performance processes, and compensation cycles 
  * Guide leaders through rigorous documentation, PIPs, and talent actions when needed

**Change Leadership**

  * Partner with leaders on implementing new systems, processes, and cultural expectations as we scale
  * Improve communication clarity and speed across our globally distributed team

**People Operations for Revenue & Marketing**

  * Serve as a functional lead for GTM employee relations, policy interpretation, and compliance (in partnership with People Ops)  
  

### **What You Bring**

  * 5-10 years in an HRBP role supporting technical teams in high-growth SaaS or product-driven companies
  * Strong ability to influence without authority and build trust with senior leaders
  * Experience diagnosing organizational issues and designing interventions that improve execution
  * Comfortable operating with incomplete information and creating clarity in ambiguity
  * Deep coaching experience with managers and senior ICs
  * Ability to quickly understand GTM environments, role types, and how sales and customer-facing teams operate
  * High judgment, calm communication, and a bias toward action over theatrics
  * Proficiency in MAC OS

[**Matcha.xyz**](http://Matcha.xyz)****(our flagship consumer DEX aggregator)

### Overview

Supabase is the Postgres development platform, built by developers for
developers. We provide a complete backend solution including Database, Auth,
Storage, Edge Functions, Realtime, and Vector Search. All services are deeply
integrated and designed for growth.

Weâ€™re seeking a Customer Reliability Engineer (CRE) to help ensure we have a
pro-active and partnership-driven approach towards reliability, performance
and customer satisfaction for our largest and most strategically important
customers.

At Supabase, CREâ€™s are responsible for the entire customer journey, working
closely with our most valuable users to:

  1. Apply SRE principles to Customer Success - enabling customers and team members to monitor and proactively assist our most important customers.

  2. Detect issues commonly occurring in the platform, either underlying or immediate, and work with teams to ensure their priority is recognised.

  3. Proactively find improvements in the platform and methods of implementation that can unblock them

  4. Work with customers to utilise features that might not be in the platform, or on the roadmap.

  5. Work on escalations and longer-running, more complex technical cases that come from Support Engineers and Customer Solution Architects.

Successful CREs can be embedded with different teams, earning trust by
advocating for features that unblock customers and/or internal teams. You'll
be joining our team to support Supabase Team & Enterprise customers, where you
will be expected to lead and innovate around the following areas of
responsibility:

### Engineering

  * Working with Engineering and Infrastructure Teams to deliver features. This can include:

    * Features that might not be on the immediate roadmap but significant benefit has been shown to strategic customers.

    * Assisting with the delivery of significant features, both internally and externally, through testing, documenting and following the release process.

  * Advising teams as they plan and implement functionality; using your expertise to guide the optimal implementation and help to surface the â€œcostâ€ of implementing.

  * Help internal teams prioritise based on feedback from the Success team; through championing newer requests and getting bigger projects over the line.

### **Customer Success**

  * Assist those using the Supabase platform with complex and/or long-running issues; providing guidance, best practice and your knowledge to ensure the best outcomes for the customer.

  * Enable the broader Support and Success teams internally, ensuring documentation and examples are passed on and visibility of your work is maximised.

  * Deliver on synchronous and asynchronous engagements with Supabase customers, including application architecture assessments, database design and performance optimization, and proactive support to enable customers to scale with confidence.

  * Serve as an internal champion for the platform and how customers use it. Work closely within Success, as well as with Support, Product, and Engineering to provide platform feedback, identify areas of improvement, while communicating platform roadmaps to customers.

### **Preferred Experience**

  * 6+ years of relevant work experience in Database Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering, Solution Architecture or similar.

  * Strong background with relational database management systems such as PostgreSQL or MySQL.

  * Background in web application development, with familiarity in Python, Typescript and popular JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue, Svelte) as well as Node.js.

  * Very strong communication skills, particularly of technical concepts. CREâ€™s at Supabase spend a significant amount of time translating business needs to technical outcomes, and technical concepts to organizational impact.

    * Clear, concise communication that is regular, tone-aware (i.e. technical for technical audiences) and thorough is our North Star

  * Experience with project management, business analysis and revenue operations tools. We use HubSpot, BigQuery etc., and familiarity with these platforms will help enable your success. Previous experience working cross-teams is an incredibly helpful asset.

  * Previous experience leading customer-facing engagements to deliver meaningful technical and business value.

  * Driven and team-focussed - You can work within the context of a task, communicate progress and bring in relevant expertise at the right time to ensure successful deliverables.

### **What We Offer**

  * **Fully Remote**

We hire globally. We believe you can do your best work from anywhere. There
are no Supabase offices, but we provide a WeWork membership or co-working
allowance you can use anywhere in the world.

  * **ESOP**

Every team member receives ESOP (equity ownership) in the company. We want
everyone to share in the upside of what weâ€™re building together.

  * **Tech Allowance**

Use this budget to set up your ideal work environmentâ€”laptop, monitor,
headphones, or whatever helps you do your best work.

  * **Health Benefits**

Supabase covers 100% of health insurance for employees and 80% for dependents,
wherever you are. Your wellbeing and your familyâ€™s health are important to us.

  * **Annual Off-Sites**

Once a year, the entire company gathers in a new city for a week of
connection, collaboration, and fun. Itâ€™s a highlight of our year.

  * **Flexible Work**

We operate asynchronously and trust you to manage your own time. You know what
needs to be done and when.

  * **Professional Development**

Every team member receives an annual education allowance to spend on
learningâ€”courses, books, conferences, or anything that supports your growth.

### **About the Team**

Supabase was born-remote and open-source-first. We believe our globally
distributed team is our secret weapon in building tools developers love.

  * 180+ team members

  * 40+ countries

  * 15+ languages spoken

  * $496M raised

  * 430,000+ community members

  * 30,000+ memes posted (and counting)

We move fast, build in public, and use what we ship. If itâ€™s in your project,
we probably use it in ours too. We believe deeply in the open-source ecosystem
and strive to supportâ€”not replaceâ€”existing tools and communities.

### **Hiring Process**

We keep things simple, async-friendly, and respectful of your time:

  1. Apply â€“ Our team will review your application.

  2. Intro Call â€“ A short video chat to get to know each other.

  3. Interviews â€“ Up to four calls with:

     * Founders

     * Future teammates

     * Someone cross-functional from product, growth, or engineering (depending on the role)

  4. Decision â€“ We may follow up with a final question or go straight to offer.

All communication is remote and we aim to move fast.

**About Us**

Parity is one of the worldâ€™s most experienced companies building the core
infrastructure behind blockchain â€” the system that allows information and
value to be shared securely without needing an intermediary. Weâ€™re laying the
foundation for a better web which respects the freedom and data of
individuals, and empowers developers to build better, more trustworthy online
services.

Our remote-first, global team develops open-source software that anyone can
use or improve. This includes [Polkadot](https://polkadot.network/), [Polkadot
SDK](https://substrate.io/), and [Kusama](https://kusama.network/) â€” key parts
of the Web3 tech stack, the next generation of the internet. Our mission is to
make Polkadot the most active and innovative community in blockchain, powering
a new era of connected and decentralised applications.

**About the Team**

This role sits in our **Acceleration department** , home to the people who
drive ecosystem growth by building tools, integrations, and partnerships
across the Polkadot network.

Reporting into our Engineering Product Lead, youâ€™ll be joining our Product
Development team. The Product team defines priorities and works across
engineering to design and deliver new features that improve Polkadotâ€™s
products and user experience.

The team gathers feedback, solves user problems, and helps make sure what we
build is useful, usable, and adopted products across the ecosystem.

**About the Role**

As an Android Engineer, youâ€™ll be leading the charge in crafting next-gen
digital products for users to interact with Polkadot and the decentralised
world beyond.

**What youâ€™ll do**

  * Architect & Build â€“ Design and develop fluid, high-performance Android applications.

  * Create Beautiful UX â€“ Build smooth, intuitive interfaces that make crypto adoption easy.

  * Innovate & Optimise â€“ Solve many complex challenges like cross-chain transactions, and zero-trust security models.

  * Stay Cutting-Edge â€“ Implement the latest blockchain SDKs, cryptographic security measures, to solve real-world mobile problems at scale.

  * Collaborate Globally â€“ Work with engineers, product managers, and the wider blockchain community to push the limits of whatâ€™s possible.

**Your skills**

  * Solid experience in Android development with Kotlin.

  * Strong expertise in Jetpack Compose, Coroutines, and MVVM architecture.

  * Deep understanding of encryption, and secure data storage.

  * Experience working with REST APIs, WebSockets, and real-time data handling.

**About Working With Us**

Joining Parity means joining team mates who are genuinely excited about the
impact their projects are having, and the opportunity to grow alongside some
of the brightest minds in the Web3 space! Youâ€™ll work remotely and flexibly,
while still getting to meet your team mates throughout the year at team and
company-wide retreats.

Upon receiving an offer, all candidates **undergo a background check** through
[Zinc](https://zincwork.com/candidates), our trusted third-party provider.
Team members will be taken on as **a contractor via our UK entity**. View our
[Applicant Notice](https://www.parity.io/applicant-notice/) to see how we use
your data.

Parity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. **We welcome diversity** in our
global team and care about everyone in our collective feeling included and
welcome

Is this position not quite your match? [Browse](https://www.parity.io/jobs/)
our other open roles.

**Who We Are and What We are Doing:**

Ethena Labs is actively building and deploying a suite of groundbreaking
digital dollar products aiming to upgrade money into the internet era.

  

Our flagship product, USDe, is a synthetic dollar backed by digital assets,
and takes the novel approach of using a delta-neutral hedged basis strategy to
maintain its peg. This product scaled from zero to $15b in 18 months.

  

Expanding on this, iUSDe is designed specifically for traditional financial
institutions, incorporating necessary compliance features to enable them to
access the crypto-native rewards our protocol generates, in an institutional-
friendly manner.

  

Ethena has also developed USDtb: a fiat backed GENIUS compliant stablecoin in
partnership with BlackRock which has scaled to ~$2b.

  

These products are also offered in a whitelabel stablecoin offering where any
application, chain, wallet or exchange can launch their own stablecoin on
Ethena's back-end infrastructure.

  

Through these offerings, Ethena Labs is not just creating new financial
products; we are building the foundational infrastructure for a more open,
efficient, and interconnected global financial system.

  

Open job offerings will be focused on two new major product lines coming to
market in the next few months.

  

Join us!!

  

**Location: Portugal**

  

**The Role**

  

As a Financial Associate, your mission is to assist the Finance Manager in
scaling a robust, Web3-native accounting and control environment. You will
play a pivotal role in ensuring that the organization accurately captures,
classifies, and reconciles both fiat and onchain financial activity across
multiple entities and products.

  

When you join, youâ€™ll be a core part of the Finance Team. This position owns
the core accounting operations, ranging from transaction recording and complex
reconciliations to month end close support and audit readiness. Reporting
directly to the Finance Manager, you will work to bridge the gap between
traditional general ledger systems and crypto data sources. This is an ideal
role for a detail oriented accounting professional looking to deepen their
expertise in the evolving digital asset landscape.

**Location: Portugal**

  

**The Role**

  

As a Financial Associate, your mission is to assist the Finance Manager in
scaling a robust, Web3-native accounting and control environment. You will
play a pivotal role in ensuring that the organization accurately captures,
classifies, and reconciles both fiat and onchain financial activity across
multiple entities and products.

  

When you join, youâ€™ll be a core part of the Finance Team. This position owns
the core accounting operations, ranging from transaction recording and complex
reconciliations to month end close support and audit readiness. Reporting
directly to the Finance Manager, you will work to bridge the gap between
traditional general ledger systems and crypto data sources. This is an ideal
role for a detail oriented accounting professional looking to deepen their
expertise in the evolving digital asset landscape.

### What Youâ€™ll Do

* Reliably record purchase, sales, intercompany, and treasury transactions across fiat and digital asset accounts. You will ensure precise coding, VAT/tax treatment, and the maintenance of robust supporting documentation.
* Perform recurring reconciliations across bank accounts, custodians, exchanges, and on-chain wallets. You will investigate breaks and clear unmatched items to improve reconciliation support files.
* Execute supplier and treasury payments across fiat and digital asset rails, ensuring all runs follow strict approval workflows and are accurately recorded.
* Support the link between Web3 accounting software and the general ledger. You will validate transaction completeness and investigate mismatches using blockchain explorers.
* Assist with multi entity consolidation by preparing entity level schedules, intercompany reconciliations, and data packs for group reporting and regulatory requests.
* Prepare transaction schedules for VAT and tax filings. You will work to reduce follow-up queries from local accountants and maintain an "audit ready" trail of evidence.
* Prepare and post accruals, prepayments, and depreciation entries to enhance the quality and consistency of the month end close process.

### What Weâ€™re Looking For

* Proven experience in a financial accounting role, preferably within a multi-entity or international environment where youâ€™ll have had responsibilities in IFRS and financial accounting operations. You must be able to execute recurring tasks with a sharp eye for supporting documentation.
* A mindset geared toward identifying inefficiencies and suggesting practical improvements to scaling workflows in executing payment runs and monitoring balance movements across bank accounts, custodians, exchanges, and stablecoin wallets.
* Knowledge of blockchain explorers (e.g., Etherscan) to verify transfers. Experience with (or a strong desire to learn) crypto sub-ledgers like Cryptio, Cryptoworth, or Tres.
* Experience of organizing working papers and maintaining a structured audit trail that meets institutional requirements.

**Why Ethena Labs?**

  

You'd be joining a group that has well established itself as one of the most
successful crypto-native company's of all time, a group with a mission to
revolutionise decentralised finance and it's position in global finance.

  

Work alongside a passionate and innovative team that values collaboration and
creativity.

Enjoy a flexible, remote-friendly work environment with established
opportunities for personal growth and learning.

  

If you subscribe to the mission of separating the dollar from the state, then
we want to hear from you!

  

We look forward to receiving your application and will be in touch after
having a chance to review.

  

**In the meantime, here are some links to more information about Ethena Labs
to help you check us out:**

[**Website**](https://www.ethena.fi/)

[**Twitter/X**](https://twitter.com/ethena_labs?s=21&t=axGgKq-f7xtb_IGY1vq9gA)

[**LinkedIn**](https://www.linkedin.com/company/ethena-labs)

Expanding on this, iUSDe is designed specifically for traditional financial

Ethena has also developed USDtb: a fiat backed GENIUS compliant stablecoin in

These products are also offered in a whitelabel stablecoin offering where any

Through these offerings, Ethena Labs is not just creating new financial

postTitle: Manager of Cloud Platform Engineering at Fingerprint
jobTitle: Manager of Cloud Platform Engineering at Fingerprint
descContent:
**Fingerprint** empowers developers to stop online fraud at the source.

We work on turning radical new ideas in the fraud detection space into
reality. Our products are developer-focused and our clients range from solo
developers to publicly traded companies. **We are a globally dispersed, 100%
remote company** with a strong open-source focus. Our flagship open-source
project is [FingerprintJS](https://github.com/fingerprintjs/fingerprintjs)
(20K stars on GitHub).

[We have raised $77M
](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/fingerprintjs)and are backed by
Craft Ventures (previously invested in [Tesla,
](https://www.tesla.com/)[Facebook, ](https://facebook.com/)[Airbnb
](https://www.airbnb.com/)), Nexus Venture Partners (previously invested in
[Postman](https://www.postman.com/), [Apollo.io,](https://www.apollo.io/)
[MinIO](https://min.io/), Druva) and Uncorrelated Ventures (previously
invested in [Redis, ](https://redis.io/)[Rollbar ](https://rollbar.com/)&[
Gradle](https://gradle.org/)).

_We have noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry,
where scammers attempt to access candidates' personal and financial
information through fake interviews and offers. All Fingerprint recruiting
email communications will always come from the @fingerprint.com domain. Any
outreach claiming to be from Fingerprint via other sources should be ignored._

Manager of Cloud Platform Engineering

### The Role in Context

Fingerprint is scaling rapidly, and our infrastructure is the bedrock of our
25B+ annual request volume. We are looking for a **Manager of Cloud Platform
Engineering** to lead a team of 6 elite engineers.

In this role, you arenâ€™t just keeping the lights onâ€”you are the architect of
our scalability, the guardian of our hosting efficiency, and the primary
bridge between Engineering and Finance. You will have high autonomy to define
what "best-in-class" infrastructure looks like for a high-growth SaaS leader.

### Your Mission

  * **Lead & Elevate:** Direct a team of 6 Cloud Engineers. You will foster a culture of high ownership, technical excellence, and "Infrastructure as Code" (IaC) first.
  * **Scale the Platform:** Oversee the evolution of our **AWS EKS** clusters, ensuring they remain resilient, performant, and secure under massive load.
  * **Strategic FinOps:** Partner directly with the Finance team to manage hosting costs. You will be responsible for cost-visibility, and driving a "cost-conscious" engineering culture.
  * **Establish the Standard:** Define and enforce infrastructure best practices (security, CI/CD, observability) across the entire engineering organization.

### What Youâ€™ll Do

  * **Operational Excellence:** Manage and improve our modern DevOps stack, including **ArgoCD** for GitOps, **GitHub Actions** for CI/CD, and **Cloudflare** for edge protection.
  * **Architecture & Governance:** Act as the primary technical advisor for cloud architecture. Ensure that as product teams build new features, the underlying infrastructure is scalable by default.
  * **Autonomy & Influence:** Operate with minimal guidance to identify bottlenecks, propose architectural shifts, and lead their execution.
  * **Stakeholder Partnership:** Be the "visible lead" for infrastructure. Distill complex technical tradeoffs into business-ready decisions for Finance and Product leadership.

### Qualifications

**Required:**

  * **Leadership Experience:** 5+ years managing engineering teams in a cloud-native environment, with a total of 10+ years in technology.
  * **AWS Mastery:** Deep expertise in the AWS ecosystem, specifically **EKS (Kubernetes)** , IAM, VPC, and RDS.
  * **Modern DevOps Stack:** Expert-level knowledge of GitOps workflows (**ArgoCD**), CI/CD pipelines (**GitHub Actions**), and Infrastructure as Code (**Terraform**).
  * **FinOps & Cost Management:** Proven track record of managing seven-figure cloud budgets and implementing successful cost-reduction strategies.
  * **Autonomy:** Demonstrated ability to lead complex initiatives from conception to completion with minimal oversight.

**Preferred:**

  * **Security Mindset:** Familiarity with SOC 2 compliance, network security, and zero-trust principles.
  * **Cloudflare:** Experience managing WAF, Workers, or CDN configurations at the edge.

### Why This Role?

  * **High Impact:** You own the foundation of a product that prevents fraud for the worldâ€™s largest brands.
  * **Modern Tools:** No legacy "on-prem" baggage. We are 100% cloud-native and committed to the best modern tooling.
  * **Leadership Freedom:** You will have the budget and the mandate to build the infrastructure team of your dreams.

**_Compensation Range_**

_For**US-based employees** , the cash compensation range for this role is
**$150,000 â€“ $215,000**. We set standard ranges for all US roles based on
function, level, and geographic location, benchmarked against similar stage
growth companies. To comply with local legislation and provide greater
transparency, we share salary ranges on all job postings. **However, these
ranges are specific to the hiring location and may differ within or outside
the US.**_

_We have noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry,
where scammers attempt to access candidates' personal and financial
information through fake interviews and offers. All Fingerprint recruiting
email communications will always come from the @fingerprint.com domain. Any
outreach claiming to be from Fingerprint via other sources should be ignored._

Offers vary depending on, but not limited to, relevant experience, education,
certifications/licenses, skills, training, and market conditions.

Due to regulatory and security reasons, thereâ€™s a small number of countries
where we cannot have Fingerprint teammates based. **Additionally, because
Fingerprint is an all-remote company and people can join our workforce from
almost any country, we do not sponsor visas. Fingerprint teammates need to be
authorized to work from their home location**.

We are dedicated to creating an inclusive work environment for everyone. We
embrace and celebrate the unique experiences, perspectives and cultural
backgrounds that each employee brings to our workplace. Fingerprint strives to
foster an environment where our employees feel respected, valued and
empowered, and our team members are at the forefront in helping us promote and
sustain an inclusive workplace. We highly encourage people from
underrepresented groups in tech to apply.

If you are applying as a resident of California, please read our CCPA notice
[here](https://dev.fingerprint.com/docs/dpa-ccpa)

If you are applying as a resident of the EU, please read our GDPR notice
[here](https://dev.fingerprint.com/docs/dpa-gdpr)

Camunda is the **leader in enterprise agentic automation, orchestrating

boat)**** for Business Orchestration and Automation Technologies (BOAT).

  

**As a fully remote, global company, weâ€™re rewriting the rules of modern
business.** Named [GP Bullhoundâ€™s 2024 Top 100 Next Unicorn
list,](https://www.gpbullhound.com/articles/top-100-next-unicorns-the-uk-
france-and-germany-lead-with-the-most-promising-technology-companies-in-
europe/) certified as a **Great Place to Work** , and recognized by [Flexa for
true flexibility](https://flexa.careers/companies/camunda), weâ€™re growing fast
and looking for top talent to join our team. If youâ€™re excited to do

one youâ€™ve been waiting for.**

**About the Role:**

We are seeking an **Interim Director, Enterprise Success** (ES), will own and
execute a subscription service for the EMEA territory that is responsible for
providing our customers a compelling, cohesive customer experience that
accelerates, expands and protects the value they receive from Camunda. The
Director will lead and manage a team of Customer Success Managers (CSMs) and
Technical Account Managers (TAMs). The Director may also manage ES, CSM and/or
TAM managers within their territory, as the scale and needs of that territory
dictates. The Director will be responsible for customer gross retention rate
(GRR), net retention rate (NRR), net promoter score (NPS), customer health
score, and CS-sourced sales qualified opportunities (SQO) for their portfolio
of accounts. Additionally, they will be responsible for the renewal, retention
and customer satisfaction rates for the Enterprise Success subscription
service within their territory.

**What you'll be doing:**

  * Drive a significant increase in Enterprise Success attach rate, ensuring performance exceeds target.

  * Grow net retention across your supported account portfolio, consistently surpassing goals.

  * Maintain strong gross retention for your portfolio, meeting or exceeding established targets.

  * Achieve enterprise renewal rate objectives by guiding accounts through successful renewals.

**What you bring:**

  * Proven leadership experience and achievement in enterprise customer success management or account management

  * Customer networking, stakeholder, and escalation management

  * Operational excellence

  * Top talent identification, acquisition, development and retention

  * Bias for action, bias for speed

  * Ability and/or willingness to use[our product](https://accounts.cloud.camunda.io/signup?_ga=2.47330343.127558761.1654184528-504024057.1654184528).

**Nice-to-haves:**

  * Strong understanding of enterprise customer needs, challenges, and priorities relevant to Camundaâ€™s customer base

  * Executive presence and communication skills

 _**This role is an existing vacancy**_

#LI-AL1 #LI-Remote C1

**What We Have to Offer:**

**Compensation**

We offer competitive, fair, and transparent compensation. Salary ranges are
location-based, with Standard and Major markets (global tech hubs) reflecting
local competition.

**The Annual Total Target Cash**(base salary + 100% variable target, where
applicable) shown below spans from the minimum in a Standard market to the
maximum in a Major market. Final offers depend on **skills** , **experience**
, and **location** , and we typically hire in the first half of the range to
allow room for growth:

  * United States: $261,500.00 to $421,600.00 

  * United Kingdom: Â£164,200.00 to Â£270,100.00 

  * Singapore: S$324,800.00 to S$487,100.00

If youâ€™re based elsewhere, youâ€™ll be hired via
[**Remote.com**](http://Remote.com) (our global employer partner), and your
Talent Acquisition Partner will provide a personalized **Total Rewards
Calculator** after your first interview.

**Equity:** We also offer equity (where applicable) through our [**Virtual
Stock Option Plan
(VSOP)**](https://confluence.camunda.com/spaces/BP/pages/123315208/Virtual+Employee+Stock+Option+Plan+%E2%80%9CVSOP%E2%80%9D).

**Benefits & Perks**

We invest in your wellbeing, growth, and ability to connect, along with perks
that support you no matter where youâ€™re based. Our benefits are globally
designed and locally delivered where applicable.

  * **Remote & Flexible: **Work from anywhere with the setup that suits you, **home office budget, co-working space support, and flexible time off** to recharge when you need it.

  * **In Person Connection:** We invest in meaningful face time through our **Annual Kickoff**(Vienna in 2025, Madrid in 2026!), **team offsites, and Camundi Connection Budgets** , including contributing to meetups while travelling,, and local gatherings with fellow Camundi.

  * **Health & Wellbeing:** Access locally tailored healthcare, **Modern Health** for global mental wellbeing, and our **Live Well Lifestyle Spending Account (LSA),** a flexible, global benefit that puts you in control of your whole life, not just work, from: **staying active, to caring for family, exploring personal passions, meaningful experiences, and investing in your financial wellbeing.** The Live Well program launches in 2026 and scales to **â‚¬1,000 annually from 2027**.

  * **Financial Security:** Retirement and pension plans (often with company contributions), plus life and disability insurance where relevant.

  * **Professional Growth:** Up to $/â‚¬/Â£1,000 per year for self-driven learning: courses, certifications, books, you decide!

  * **More of what we offer globally & in your country can be found **[**here**](https://confluence.camunda.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=110235989)**.**

_â€Everyone is welcome at Camundaâ€_ â€” _itâ€™s a celebrated component of our
culture. We strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our
people. At Camunda, we honour diverse cultures and backgrounds and are proud
to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive
consideration without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, religion, belief,
sexual orientation, age, disability or any other protected characteristics
under applicable law. We are looking forward to your application!_

_**Come join us and be part of Camundaâ€™s incredible journey: Make an impact at

postTitle: Client Success Representative Bilingual (English & Spanish) at Bobtail
jobTitle: Client Success Representative Bilingual (English & Spanish) at Bobtail
descContent:
### About Bobtail

Bobtail is dedicated to increasing happiness by eliminating inefficiencies in
the supply chain. We envision a supply chain without friction, fraud, waste,
and abuse where companies succeed based on the value they create.

We work uniquely at Bobtail, where we value teams over individuals and
constantly encourage experimentation and iteration to improve. Teams are given
flexibility in working towards a shared purpose and the freedom to decide how
they will accomplish their goals.

If you are an out-of-the-box thinker that takes a proactive approach to
collaborate with others to solve problems and achieve your goals - we would
love to talk to you.

The things we value:

  1. Mission
  2. Teams over individuals
  3. Collaboration
  4. Communication
  5. Iteration
  6. Experimentation and failing fast
  7. Initiative and solutions-oriented approach
  8. Documentation
  9. Data
  10. Mental health and work-life balance
  11. Diversity
  12. Transparency

### You should apply if you have:

  * Customer service experience
  * At least 6 months tenure in Bobtail
  * Speak both English & Spanish fluently
  * Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
  * Time management and multitasking skills in order to handle multiple tasks and clients at once
  * Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  * Capable of prioritizing tasks/requests to meet the client & company needs
  * Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

### You will be responsible for:

  * Act as the first point of contact for company clients
  * Resolve complaints and prevent additional issues by improving processes.
  * Build & maintain a good relationship with assigned carriers based on trust and respect
  * Collaborate with internal departments to fulfill carrier needs
  * Maintain up-to-date knowledge of assigned accounts
  * Answer incoming calls from carriers, brokers & potential new clients
  * Communicate with assigned carriers via email, text, or phone

### Benefits

  * Monthly Mental Break Day
  * Paid Time Off
  * Work from home (or wherever)
  * Parental leave

Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is Bobtailâ€™s nucleus. We are an
equal opportunity employer and embrace people of different backgrounds,
cultures, religions, national origins, races, colors, genders, gender
expressions, sexual orientations, ages, marital status, veteran status,
experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

opportunities to validate and iterate with passionate customers and internal

**What you bring:**

  * Ability and/or willingness to use [our product](https://accounts.cloud.camunda.io/signup?_ga=2.47330343.127558761.1654184528-504024057.1654184528).

  * 5+ years designing complex enterprise B2B software

  * Strong UX craft for technical users (workflows/journeys, not just screens)

  * UX strategy + systems thinking across connected experiences

  * High ownership + momentum: takes initiative, drives progress, and thrives in close partnership with PM and Engineering

  * Candid communication + strong design rationale

  * Validation mindset (customer/internal) and outcome orientation

  * Hands-on AI/agentic experience design (guardrails, control, evaluating trust/quality)

  * Proficiency with Figma (or similar); self-organized remote work

**Nice-to-haves:**

  * Technical/engineering background (degree or equivalent experience)

  * Platform/ops domain experience (console/admin, security/identity, reliability/observability, developer tooling)

  * Familiarity with orchestration/workflow automation concept

 _**This role is an existing vacancy**_

location-based, with Standard and Major markets (global tech hubs) reflecting

Sundogs | Senior Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer | Remote EST / CET | Part-Time

We're Sundogs, an early-stage startup (15 people) founded by ex-Googlers, we
use AI and human creative expertise to transform video advertising.

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst (Python/SQL) on a part-time /
freelance basis to help deliver and productize some strategic analyses we
provide to our clients. The analyses tap into a large & rich dataset of 500+
video creative components, to help brand refine their creative approach in
video advertising.

The job is full remote, we look for candidates between the CET and EST
timezones, in Europe or US/Canada (Western Europe / Eastern US).

Full JD: <https://tinyurl.com/4ekfzfzj> Find out more: <https://sundogs.io/>

To apply, please send your resume and an intro at work@sundogs.io.

A** practical session with a powerhouse panel on leading modern, remote
teams._[_**Register here**_](https://camunda.com/wb-life-at-camunda/) _**!**_

Camunda is the **leader in enterprise agentic automation, orchestrating
complex business processes** , including high-value knowledge work, across
agents, people, and systems. By creating production-ready, enterprise-grade
agents with built-in governance, Camunda uniquely delivers trusted AI agents
for business-critical processes. **Over 700 leading innovators like Atlassian,
ING, and Vodafone, rely on Camunda** to slash time-to-value from months to
days, boost operational efficiency, and elevate customer experiences. Camunda
was named a****_**Visionary**_**** in the inaugural [**2025 GartnerÂ® Magic
Quadrantâ„¢**](https://page.camunda.com/wp-2025-gartner-magic-quadrant-for-
boat)**** for Business Orchestration and Automation Technologies (BOAT).

  

**As a fully remote, global company, weâ€™re rewriting the rules of modern
business.** Named [GP Bullhoundâ€™s 2024 Top 100 Next Unicorn
list,](https://www.gpbullhound.com/articles/top-100-next-unicorns-the-uk-
france-and-germany-lead-with-the-most-promising-technology-companies-in-
europe/) certified as a **Great Place to Work** , and recognized by [Flexa for
true flexibility](https://flexa.careers/companies/camunda), weâ€™re growing fast
and looking for top talent to join our team. If youâ€™re excited to do
meaningful work and make real impact, keep reading, **this role could be the
one youâ€™ve been waiting for.**

**About the role:**

In this Engineering Manager role at Camunda, you will lead the team that
builds our common canvas experience for modeling BPMN and process
orchestration. This modelling canvas is where customers design and implement
how work flows through their business, so your teamâ€™s work is both highly
visible and deeply impactful. Youâ€™ll combine thoughtful people leadership with
solid engineering judgment to help a diverse, remote team ship a highâ€‘quality
modeling experience, collaborate closely with Product and Design, and
continuously improve how teams build and operate process orchestration at
scale.

_Curious about the kind of challenges you'll work on at Camunda? Watch this
quick_[ _30-minute talk_](https://www.camundacon.com/event-session/camundacon-
amsterdam-2025/one-exporter-to-rule-them-all-exploring-camunda-
exporter/?on_demand=true) _from our engineers to learn more about the new
Camunda Exporter and how weâ€™re solving complex problems at scale_

**What Youâ€™ll Be Doing:**

  * Lead and grow a highâ€‘performing team responsible for the modelling canvas used to design and orchestrate processes (BPMN and related notations), ensuring the experience is intuitive, reliable, and evolves with customer needs. 

  * Own delivery and quality for your area: align work to a clear roadmap, balance new feature development with UX and technical excellence, and make sure we ship incrementally, safely, and predictably.

  * Partner closely with Product Management and Design to shape the next-generation canvas vision, clarify requirements, make pragmatic tradeâ€‘offs, and ensure weâ€™re solving real customer problems, not just building features. 

  * Support operations and incident response for your services: work with your team to define onâ€‘call / escalation practices, respond to issues, and communicate clearly with stakeholders when something breaks or needs to change. 

  * Develop and enable your team members, providing regular feedback, coaching, and growth opportunities so they can expand their skills, take on more complex work, and do their best work at Camunda. 

  * Contribute to hiring and engineering culture by partnering with Talent Acquisition, designing fair, skillsâ€‘based interviews, and sharing best practices with other managers in Engineering.

**What You Bring:**

  * Ability and/or willingness to use [our product](https://accounts.cloud.camunda.io/signup?_ga=2.47330343.127558761.1654184528-504024057.1654184528)

  * Experience leading software engineers as a people manager, including responsibility for performance, mentoring, and dayâ€‘toâ€‘day team health. 

  * Proven track record delivering userâ€‘facing product features endâ€‘toâ€‘end in collaboration with Product and Design, ideally in a SaaS or cloudâ€‘based environment. 

  * Solid understanding of modern engineering practices (e.g., code review, automated testing, continuous delivery, observability) and how to apply them pragmatically within a team. 

  * Comfort with incident and escalation management: you know how to help teams prioritize, respond under pressure, and communicate clearly and transparently with internal stakeholders. 

  * Strong communication and collaboration skills in a remoteâ€‘first setting, including the ability to give and receive candid feedback, align people around goals, and keep stakeholders informed without unnecessary meetings.

**Nice-to-haves:**

  * Experience with developer tools, modeling tools, design systems, or visual editors (e.g., diagramming, canvasâ€‘based UIs, BPMN/DMN tools).

  * Familiarity with process orchestration / BPMN or workflow engines (Camunda or similar). 

  * Background working on highly interactive frontâ€‘end applications (e.g., TypeScript/React or similar modern web stacks) in partnership with UX.

  * Experience leading the development of user-facing authoring tools, with direct responsibility for integrating AI-driven capabilities (e.g. intelligent assistance, content generation, validation, or automation).

  * Experience working in or with distributed, multiâ€‘team product organizations, where shared components (like a common canvas) are used across multiple products.

  * Experience with encouraging the adoption of AI usage within their organization.

_**This role is an existing vacancy**_

We offer competitive, fair, and transparent compensation. Salary ranges are

If youâ€™re based elsewhere, youâ€™ll be hired via
[**Remote.com**](http://Remote.com) (our global employer partner), and your
Talent Acquisition Partner will provide a personalized **Total Rewards
Calculator** after your first interview.

**Equity:** We also offer equity (where applicable) through our [**Virtual
Stock Option Plan
(VSOP)**](https://confluence.camunda.com/spaces/BP/pages/123315208/Virtual+Employee+Stock+Option+Plan+%E2%80%9CVSOP%E2%80%9D).

**Benefits & Perks**

We invest in your wellbeing, growth, and ability to connect, along with perks
that support you no matter where youâ€™re based. Our benefits are globally
designed and locally delivered where applicable.

  * **Remote & Flexible: **Work from anywhere with the setup that suits you, **home office budget, co-working space support, and flexible time off** to recharge when you need it.

  * **In Person Connection:** We invest in meaningful face time through our **Annual Kickoff**(Vienna in 2025, Madrid in 2026!), **team offsites, and Camundi Connection Budgets** , including contributing to meetups while travelling,, and local gatherings with fellow Camundi.

  * **Health & Wellbeing:** Access locally tailored healthcare, **Modern Health** for global mental wellbeing, and our **Live Well Lifestyle Spending Account (LSA),** a flexible, global benefit that puts you in control of your whole life, not just work, from: **staying active, to caring for family, exploring personal passions, meaningful experiences, and investing in your financial wellbeing.** The Live Well program launches in 2026 and scales to **â‚¬1,000 annually from 2027**.

  * **Financial Security:** Retirement and pension plans (often with company contributions), plus life and disability insurance where relevant.

  * **Professional Growth:** Up to $/â‚¬/Â£1,000 per year for self-driven learning: courses, certifications, books, you decide!

  * **More of what we offer globally & in your country can be found **[**here**](https://confluence.camunda.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=110235989)**.**

_â€Everyone is welcome at Camundaâ€_ â€” _itâ€™s a celebrated component of our
culture. We strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our
people. At Camunda, we honour diverse cultures and backgrounds and are proud

postTitle: Payroll and Hiring Generalist at Expensify
jobTitle: Payroll and Hiring Generalist at Expensify
descContent:
### **Your Mission, Should You Choose To Accept**

At Expensify, our people are at the heart of everything we do, and a great
employee experience starts with the basics: getting paid, having wonderful
experiences, and surrounded by incredible teammates. Weâ€™re excited to add a
Payroll & Hiring Generalist to help us keep our team happy, supported, and
excited to be here.  
  
In this role, youâ€™ll ensure seamless payroll for our U.S. employees through
our in-house system, while also supporting payroll for our international
employees and contractors. Youâ€™ll help grow our global team by reviewing
applications, speaking with candidates, and refining our unique hiring
process. And along the way, youâ€™ll join in the fun side of our culture too,
from our annual Onshore gathering to our three-week Offshore adventure abroad.

### **Payroll and Hiring Generalist At Expensify**

**Payroll & Compliance**

  * Run payroll for U.S. employees using Expensifyâ€™s proprietary in-house payroll system.

  * Support payroll administration for international employees and contractors across entities.

  * Ensure compliance with U.S. federal, state, and local tax and benefits regulations, as well as international requirements.

  * Support quarterly equity events, SOX controls, and compliance tasks.

  * Partner with Finance to reconcile payroll records and ensure reporting accuracy.

  * Become a subject matter expert on our U.S. payroll system and collaborate with engineering on improvements.

**Hiring & Recruiting**

  * Find great candidates, connect with them through phone screens, and keep the hiring pipeline moving by coordinating interviews and communications. 

  * Suggest and implement improvements and automation to our hiring process as we expand. 

  * Get creative with sourcing strategies to identify hard-to-find talent. 

  * Help build and maintain strong pipelines for our ongoing roles.

**Culture & Events**

  * Jump in to support planning for our annual Onshore and Offshore events.

  * Help maintain Expensifyâ€™s unique, fun, and connected culture across offices.**About You**

  * You have payroll experience, with a strong grasp of U.S. payroll (taxes, benefits, compliance) and exposure to international employees or contractors.

  * Youâ€™re detail-oriented and dependable, youâ€™re the type of person that sweats the small stuff!

  * Youâ€™re curious about people and excited to keep building our diverse team

  * You manage your time well and can easily reprioritize when new tasks or challenges come up

  * Youâ€™re collaborative and flexible, happy to pitch in on culture-building projects when needed

  * Bonus points: you have experience automating back office processes with AI or using Alteryx

  * Youâ€™re based in Portland, OR or San Francisco, CA.

### **About You**

You have payroll experience and are familiar with U.S. payroll fundamentals
(taxes, benefits, compliance), with exposure to international employees or
contractors being a plus.

  * Youâ€™re detail-oriented and dependable, youâ€™re the type of person that sweats the small stuff!

  * Youâ€™re curious about people and excited to keep building our diverse team

  * You manage your time well and can easily reprioritize when new tasks or challenges come up

  * Youâ€™re collaborative and flexible, happy to pitch in on culture-building projects when needed

  * Bonus points: you have experience automating back office processes with AI or using Alteryx

  * You're based in the US and available to work PST business hours occasionally for critical payroll deadlines and hiring coordination.

### **Compensation & Benefits **

  * Full-time salaried position with starting compensation of 90,000 - 130,000 USD, including equity

  * 401 (k) with up to 4.5% employer match

  * 100% Medical/Dental/Vision contributions

  * Up to $20k on fertility, adoption, or annual family planning benefits through Carrot

  * Free lunch when you work from the office!

  * Up to three months of fully paid parental leave, with up to six months for birthing parents

  * Commuter benefits

  * Flexible vacation policy

### **Next Steps**

Like what you see? Applying is easy, but it takes time. See, while we know
you're awesome, it's actually really hard and time-consuming to find you in
the midst of literally hundreds of other applications we get from everyone
else. So this is where we're going to ask our first favor: can you make it
really easy and obvious how great you are, so we don't accidentally overlook
you? There are many ways to do that, but the easiest way to help us out is by
answering the following questions:

  1. Are you based in the US?

  2. When did you first start supporting people at work, and what have you been doing since then?

  3. What is your proudest success story from your career so far?

  4. Can you share an example of a time you turned a complicated or messy process into something clear and easy for others? How did you do it, and what difference did it make?

  5. Tell us about an audacious, personal goal you are working towards.

  6. How did you hear about us? A job posting? Chalk on a sidewalk? From a friend? Let us know where you saw this opening. 

**Please note that we are only looking for candidates who are based in San
Francisco, CA, or Portland, OR.**

### **Resume not your thing? Thatâ€™s great, we donâ€™t really read them anyway!
Forward your responses to the questions
to**[**apply@expensify.com**](mailto:apply@expensify.com)**. We're excited to
hear from you!**

Weâ€™re committed to providing a fair and inclusive hiring experience. If you
need a reasonable accommodation at any stage of the process, just let us
knowâ€”weâ€™re happy to help

and looking for top talent to join our team. If youâ€™re excited to do

one youâ€™ve been waiting for.**

**About the Role:**

At Camunda, we care deeply about doing impactful work together. As our
Manager, Payroll Accounting, youâ€™ll build and lead a best-in-class payroll
accounting function that ensures accuracy, transparency, and trust at scale.
Youâ€™ll own the month-end close for payroll-related accounts, strengthen our
controls, and partner closely with People Operations, Accounting, FP&A, and
external payroll providers. If you love turning complexity into clarity,
improving processes, and helping teams succeed, this role is a chance to make
a visible, company-wide impact.

**What You Will Do:**

  * Own the global payroll accounting close end-to-end, including accruals, journal entries, reconciliations, variance analysis, and balance sheet integrity across all entities.

  * Balance hands-on execution with process leadership, especially during the transition period.

  * Establish and maintain clear, audit-ready documentation such as SOPs, RACIs, and process maps.

  * Ensure strong internal controls and audit readiness, maintaining clear documentation, standardized workflows, and consistent compliance with IFRS and local GAAP requirements.

  * Partner closely with People Operations/HR, Accounting, FP&A, and external payroll providers to resolve issues, validate payroll data, and deliver accurate, timely payroll results.

  * Lead process improvements and automation initiatives across payroll-to-ledger workflows, reducing manual effort, strengthening data quality, and increasing efficiency.

  * Define, monitor, and act on key payroll accounting metrics, turning operational data into clear insights that inform decisions and support scaling payroll operations.

**What You Will Bring to the Role:**

**Must Haves:**

  * Proven experience in multi-country payroll operations (US, DE, UK, SG + vendor models), including strong payroll accounting expertise (journal entries, accruals, reconciliations, cut-offs, variance analysis).

  * Strong general ledger skills and deep understanding of payroll accounting concepts (gross-to-net, taxes, benefits, withholdings, and employer costs).

  * Demonstrated ability to partner effectively with HR/People teams and external payroll providers to ensure compliance and solve complex issues.

  * Ability to oversee vendors, enforce quality standards, and resolve complex payroll issues.

  * Strong analytical mindset with the ability to trace root causes across payroll, accounting, and compliance.

  * Experience improving and/or automating payroll-to-GL processes and controls using HRIS and payroll systems.

**Nice to Haves:**

  * Experience in a global, fast-growing SaaS or technology environment.

  * Experience with Gusto, HiBob, NetSuite, or similar payroll/HRIS/ERP systems.

  * Experience leading system implementations, migrations, or automation projects.

  * Familiarity with benefits, pensions, commissions, or payroll compliance reporting.

  * Exposure to internal and external audits, including designing and operating effective controls.

  * People leadership experience and a coaching mindset.

_**This role is an existing vacancy.**_

**About Celestia Labs**

Celestia is the first modular L1 blockchain, built for the extreme speed and
specialization required to take crypto mainstream. Today, more than 30
networks across exchanges, real-world assets, and consumer applications are
built on Celestiaâ€™s foundation.

  

**About the Team**

The Celestia Labs Team is remote first and highly distributed, with English as
our primary language for communication. We are looking for self-starters that
are excited about working in a fast-paced startup environment.

  

Much of the team lives and works in the European timezones. As such, team
members are expected to be available as needed for scheduled team meetings
between the general hours of 1pm-6pm CET.

  

This role reports directly to the CEO and will manage a team of 3.

  

**About You**

Youâ€™re an experienced product leader who has led product strategy and teams in
technically complex, market-driven environments. Youâ€™re familiar with
infrastructure and blockchain products, and you bring rigor and repeatable
success in defining and executing product strategies. Youâ€™re comfortable
operating at the executive level, making clear tradeoffs, and owning outcomes
as products scale to support demanding use cases.

* Lead and develop the Product Team, setting clear direction and accountability
* Continuously assess the competitive landscape, and conduct win/loss analysis to understand how we differentiate and why prospects choose us or competitors
* Establish rigorous user research practices: define the Ideal Customer Profile (ICP), interview users regularly, build accurate user stories, implement systems to track acquisition stages, and create feedback loops across BD, Sales, DevEx, and Engineering teams
* Shift from feature-based to outcome-based roadmaps with clear milestones and KPIs, ensuring rationale and assumptions are well-documented and communicated to current and prospective users
* Partner with BD and Marketing on user-specific pitches, one-pagers, and external materials that effectively communicate our product differentiators
* Work closely with engineering, research, and go-to-market teams to drive successful execution
* Represent product at the executive level and contribute to company-wide strategy

### Who You Are

* 7+ years of product management experience, with at least 4 years in a senior leadership role
* Proven track record of building and scaling product functions at similar tech companies
* Deep expertise in user research, market analysis, and data-driven decision making
* Experience establishing product roadmaps, KPIs, and accountability frameworks
* Demonstrated rigor and repeatable success in defining and executing product strategies
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels
* Experience working with engineering teams to balance technical constraints with user needs
* Crypto-native background with deep understanding of blockchain technology and the crypto product landscape

### Perks

* Flexible and remote work environment with multiple onsites each year
* Competitive salary and meaningful long-term compensation package
* Stipends for home office, coworking space, professional and personal growth
* 4 weeks annual vacation
* 401k and healthcare coverage for US team members

While experience in the blockchain space is preferred â€“ having general
excitement about web3 and modular blockchain technology is a must!

Buildkite [CI Devtool] | Senior Design Engineer, Web | Remote (PT preferred) | Full-time

Buildkiteâ€™s CI platform is trusted by the worldâ€™s leading engineering teams,
shipping software to over 1,000,000,000 daily users.

This is a rare â€œown the whole surfaceâ€ web role: the chance to run Buildkiteâ€™s
most visible experience end-to-end, turning brand and product narrative into a
fast, beautiful, scalable website.

This newly created role in our Brand team exists to make our web presence
fast, elegant, differentiated, and durable; a system that can evolve with our
story, showcase real proof, and ship new pages and content without painful
rebuilds or fragile hacks.

Youâ€™ll own the craft at the intersection of design quality and production-
grade frontend engineering, collaborating across the company from product to
sales to support and back again.

Apply here; <https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/buildkite/jobs/5103466008>
