postTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Email Hub at Circle
jobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Email Hub at Circle
descContent:
### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments â€” all in one place, all under
their own brand.

Weâ€™re proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, weâ€™ve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

### About the role

Weâ€™re looking for a **Senior Product Marketing Manager, Email Hub** to own
messaging, positioning, and go-to-market for one of Circleâ€™s most powerful and
fast-growing product surfaces.

Email is at the heart of how creators build durable, owned relationships with
their audience â€” and Circle customers already send **millions of emails every
month** through our platform. From newsletters and product announcements to
lifecycle automation and event reminders, Email Hub plays a critical role in
helping community businesses grow and monetize.

In this role, youâ€™ll partner closely with our **Head of Email Hub** to bring
new features and improvements to market, shaping how we tell the story of
email inside a community-first platform. Youâ€™ll report to the **Head of
Product Marketing** and work cross-functionally with Product, Design, Sales,
Customer Success, and Marketing to drive adoption, differentiation, and long-
term value.

A fun fact: creators consistently see higher open rates, click-throughs, and
revenue per subscriber when email is paired with community. Your job is to
help the world understand _why_ Circle is uniquely positioned to power the
next era of creator-led email.

### What you'll be doing

**Own messaging and positioning for Circleâ€™s Email Hub surface area.****  
**Develop and evolve clear, differentiated messaging that explains how Circle
enables creators and community businesses to build owned relationships, drive
engagement, and grow sustainably through email.

**Craft high-impact copy and product content.****  
**Write, edit, and oversee the creation of Email Hubâ€“related product content
across the website, lifecycle emails, launch assets, sales decks, and product
collateral. Your focus will be on translating complex email functionality â€”
automation, segmentation, deliverability, and analytics â€” into clear,
compelling customer value.

**Guide go-to-market strategy for Email Hub features and improvements.****  
**Partner with Product, Growth, and Engineering to plan and execute launches
for new Email Hub capabilities, optimizations, and experiments. Ensure
launches are tightly coordinated, adoption-focused, and measured against
meaningful engagement and retention outcomes.

**Enable the go-to-market team.****  
**Work closely with Sales and Customer Success to create sales enablement
materials such as pitch decks, FAQs, battlecards, demos, and internal training
that help teams confidently sell and support Circleâ€™s Email Hub.

**Develop customer-facing enablement and education.****  
**Create external resources including product guides, FAQs, help content,
onboarding flows, and best-practice examples that help customers understand
and fully leverage Email Hub to grow and engage their communities.

**Collaborate cross-functionally to drive insight-led messaging.****  
**Partner with Product, Growth, Customer Success, and Data teams to gather
customer insights, feedback, and performance data. Use these insights to
continuously refine messaging, positioning, and launch strategies for Email
Hub.

**Support Circleâ€™s broader product marketing strategy.****  
**Contribute to Circleâ€™s overall messaging and positioning framework by
ensuring Email Hub narratives are consistent, differentiated, and aligned with
Circleâ€™s community-first product vision and brand.

### What you'll need to be successful

  * Strong alignment with our values. Find our values on our [career page](https://circle.so/careers) if you havenâ€™t read up on them yet.
  * You are proficient in English (spoken, written, and reading) at a [CEFR Level C1](https://magoosh.com/english-speaking/english-proficiency-levels-a-guide-to-determining-your-level/) / [ILR Level 5](https://www.govtilr.org/).
  * 5+ years of product marketing experience, preferably within a high-growth, software company environment, with a strong emphasis on messaging, positioning, and copywriting.
  * A commitment to excellence and craft. We sweat the small details. We obsess over copy, clarity, and consistency. We hold a high bar for how our product and brand show up in the world, and we expect you to do the same.
  * Exceptional written communication skills. You are an excellent writer and editor. In a fully remote, async company, writing is one of your most important tools.
  * Proven ability to create high-impact messaging that resonates with diverse audiences and drives real outcomes, from product adoption to revenue growth.
  * Strong storytelling and simplification skills. Youâ€™re able to take complex product surfaces and translate them into clear, compelling narratives that customers immediately understand and value.
  * Experience crafting positioning frameworks and leading go-to-market strategies for new product launches, working cross-functionally from strategy through execution.
  * A deep understanding of customer personas and pain points, and a demonstrated ability to address them through thoughtful, customer-first messaging.
  * A strong sense of ownership. You take responsibility end-to-end, from defining the problem to shipping the solution and measuring impact. You donâ€™t wait to be told what to do, and you care deeply about the outcomes of your work.
  * A track record of effective cross-functional collaboration with Product, Growth, Sales, and Customer Success to deliver successful launches and campaigns.
  * A strong work ethic and comfort with high expectations. Weâ€™re a fast-growing, venture-backed company with ambitious plans. This role is high-impact and high-accountability, and itâ€™s best suited for someone who thrives in that environment.

### Bonus Points

  * Youâ€™re a growth marketer turned PMM (or have spent meaningful time in growth), and naturally think about messaging in, funnels, experimentation, and how positioning decisions drive real adoption, activation, and revenue impact.
  * Youâ€™ve worked on email or lifecycle products and know how to bring campaigns, automations, and engagement workflows to market with clarity, deliverability awareness, and a focus on real audience growth.

### $140,000 - $160,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

  * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
  * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
  * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
  * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
  * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
  * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
  * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
  * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
  * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
  * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
Hereâ€™s how our CEO, Sid Yadav, frames our hiring mission: â€œletâ€™s find talent
in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.â€ To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on
the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by
applicable laws. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment
process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in
accordance with the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** in the EU
and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the
types of personal information we collect, the purpose for collecting it, and
your rights.

**Information We Collect:** We collect the following categories of personal
information from job applicants:

  * Contact information (such as name, email address, phone number)
  * Employment history and qualifications
  * Education history
  * References and any other information you choose to share with us during the application process

**Purpose of Collection:** We collect this information for the following
purposes:

  * To assess your qualifications and suitability for the position
  * To communicate with you during the recruitment process
  * To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

**Your Rights Under GDPR and CCPA:** You have the following rights regarding
your personal information:

  * The right to request access to the personal information we hold about you.
  * The right to request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain legal exceptions.
  * The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information (Note: We do not sell personal information).

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise
your rights, please refer to our full [Privacy
Policy](https://circle.so/privacy).

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and
understood this privacy notice.

Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to
live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging
primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with
Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and
weâ€™ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon
Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise
Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the
founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company
Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that
today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

Weâ€™re looking for the worldâ€™s top builders, executors, and believers to join
us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in
[Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/bridgetarsenault/2022/06/10/a-new-home-
swapping-platform-allows-you-to-travel-the-world-like-cameron-diaz-and-kate-
winslet/?sh=203a5d0722cb) and
[TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2023/04/19/opendoor-alums-raise-15m-for-
kindred-a-home-swapping-network/).

### **The Role**

The VP of Marketing at Kindred will be the architect of our presence in the
world, defining not just how we go to market, but why we matter. This leader
will set the vision for Kindredâ€™s brand, narrative, and go-to-market strategy,
translating our mission into a compelling story that resonates with members,
partners, and the broader cultural moment.

You will build and steward a distinctive brand that feels human, aspirational,
and trusted, while designing GTM strategies that drive growth across channels
and life stages. This role blends imagination with rigor: shaping long-term
brand equity while partnering closely with product, legal, and revenue teams
to turn insight into action.

At its core, this is a role for a storyteller and systems-thinker. Someone who
can see the world as it is, articulate the world Kindred is building, and lead
others (including your team) to believe in it.

### **What youâ€™ll do**

  * Define Kindredâ€™s positioning, brand architecture, and visual identity, ensuring a cohesive expression across physical spaces, experiences, and digital channels.

  * Own annual and quarterly marketing planning, set clear campaign and creative briefs, and step in to drive execution when timelines are tight.

  * Lead a full-funnel marketing team across paid, lifecycle, community, and brand, with a strong point of view on how each channel drives growth, retention, and revenue.

  * Establish and own marketing health metrics, define the KPI stack, run weekly reviews, and deliver candid quarterly readouts to the executive team and board.

  * Act as the voice of the customer, translating insights into sharp claims, creative direction, and product or packaging decisions.

  * Hire, coach, and inspire a high-performing team, set operating rhythms, manage agencies and creators to clear performance standards, and uphold a high bar for craft and speed.

### **What is required to be successful in the role**

  * 7-10 years in marketing or a related field, marketplace experience is a plus.

  * Eye for the beat of culture and content of the moment, with a keen ability to see how your own brand can have a POV in it.

  * Eagerness to roll up your sleeves and get dirty, while also able to apply frameworks for scale.

  * Strong analytical skills, clear communicator, systems thinker, and proven record driving cross-functional partnership and accountability.

  * Storyteller by nature. Turns raw product truth into narratives people remember, repeat, and act on. Experience building an internal content department/studio is a plus.

  * Ownership mindset. Sets a few big bets, kills the rest, and holds the bar high on craft and performance.

### **Our Benefits:**

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another.
We offer a thoughtful, human-first benefits package designed to support
health, wellbeing, and connection.

Our openings may span more than one career level. The base salary offered
depends on factors such as experience, transferable skills, business needs,
impact, and market data.

  * Competitive cash compensation and equity

  * Comprehensive health benefits

  * Flexible time off, plus 12 paid holidays per year

  * 21 credits per year to stay in Kindred homes

  * $4,000 annual travel stipend to help offset travel-related costs

  * Remote-first and remote-flexible work environment, with opportunities to work from anywhere and gather in person, including at Kindred HQ in San Francisco

  * Regular team and company offsites to connect, collaborate, and build together

  * A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  * A culture of high standards, feedback, and continual growth

 _We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all
applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any
protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin,
religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender
identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family
care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status,
military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US
federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where
you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will
consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction
records._

postTitle: RevOps Content and Community Manager at Chili Piper
jobTitle: RevOps Content and Community Manager at Chili Piper
descContent:
### **About Chili Piper**

Chili Piper is a B2B SaaS startup. Our product helps clients turn inbound
leads into qualified meetings instantly, helping revenue teams connect to
buyers faster. We are a fully remote global team dedicated to solving
interesting problems, helping others, and having fun.

Weâ€™re growing fast and we're ready to take over the world (in the most civil
and appropriate way possible, of course).

### _*****CURRENTLY ONLY CONSIDERING US- AND CANADA-BASED CANDIDATES FOR THIS
ROLE*****_

###  
 **Job Description**

Chili Piper is hiring a **RevOps Content and Community Manager** to serve as a
multiplier for our agency partners, influencers, and community partnerships.
This role sits at the intersection of RevOps expertise, partner enablement,
and community-building.

Youâ€™ll bring deep operational credibility to our partner ecosystem, helping
the RevOps community understand, value, implement and advocate our technology.
Youâ€™ll turn real-world RevOps experience into repeatable enablement assets,
strengthen our competitive positioning, and build community programs that
establish Chili Piper as a trusted authority in the RevOps ecosystem.

This is a highly cross-functional role working closely with Partnerships,
Sales, Marketing, and Product, with a direct impact on partner-sourced and
partner-influenced revenue.

### **Key Responsibilities**

**Partner RevOps Enablement**

  * Act as a subject-matter expert on RevOps architecture, lead routing, lifecycle design, and meeting flows

  * Translate real-world implementation patterns into scalable partner/community enablement assets (playbooks, workflows, diagrams, decision trees)

  * Reduce friction in partner-led sales and implementations by standardizing best practices

**Partner-Led Revenue Support**

  * Support high-impact partner-led and competitive deals as a RevOps expert

  * Help partners scope complex use cases and implementations more quickly and accurately

  * Reinforce Chili Piperâ€™s differentiation versus competitors through operational expertise

**Content & Thought Leadership**

  * Develop operator-grade RevOps content that partners can use to sell, implement, and expand Chili Piper

  * Collaborate with Partnerships and Marketing to align enablement content with GTM priorities

  * Establish Chili Piper as a trusted voice in RevOps and RevTech through practical, experience-driven content

**Community & Ecosystem Development**

  * Build and nurture a community for Chili Piper partners and RevOps leaders

  * Lead partner roundtables, office hours, and enablement sessions

  * Create feedback loops from partners into Product and Partnerships teams

### **What Weâ€™re Looking For**

  * 4+ years of experience in RevOps, Revenue Systems, Consulting, or Solutions Architecture within B2B SaaS

  * Interest and membership in Ops communities

  * Hands-on experience designing and implementing lead routing, inbound flows, and lifecycle management

  * Familiarity with tools like Salesforce, Chili Piper, LeanData, Marketo, HubSpot, or similar platforms

  * Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain complex systems clearly

  * Comfort operating in a fast-paced, ambiguous, high-growth environment

  * Self-starter mindset with a strong sense of ownership and bias toward action

  * Passion for helping partners and operators succeed through practical, scalable solutions

### **Bonus Skills**

  * Prior experience working with agencies, SIs, or RevOps consultancies

  * Experience supporting partner-led or channel-driven GTM motions

  * Comfort presenting to executive, technical, and operator audiences

  * Experience building or leading professional communities

  * Familiarity with RevTech landscape (Drift, Qualified, LeanData, etc.)

  * Experience using Salesforce reporting or analytics to drive insights

### **Additional Information**

**Why you'll love being a part of our team:**

Our team loves Chili Piper because [weâ€™re building the company of the future.
](https://www.chilipiper.com/post/company-of-the-future)

  * Work with an immensely talented global team

  * Work in a business thatâ€™s run fairly and transparently

  * Competitive pay based on market rate wherever you live

  * We lead by example--showing industry peers and leaders how to innovate, improve, and grow--while having fun

**How we work:**

  * **Freedom and flexibility.** Weâ€™re a 100% distributed team working from around the world, and we've been fully remote since 2016.  _**Our team members can work from wherever they want**_ in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.

  * **Solve interesting problems.** The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.

  * **Autonomy and ownership.** Working on a distributed team means you donâ€™t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youâ€™re getting things done. Weâ€™re a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.

  * **Be helpful.** Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

**The perks:**

  * Unlimited vacation (and we _do_ mean it, and we _do_ take it!)

  * Generous health, dental, and vision insurance

  * Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job

  * Annual professional development stipend of $2,000 USD

  * Equity - all Pipers receive stock options

  * Annual company retreat for a week of bonding and adventure (previous retreat locations include Paris, Morocco, Tulum, Iceland, Ibiza, and India!)

  * Experience crafting positioning frameworks and leading go-to-market strategies for new product launches, working cross-functionally from strategy through execution.
  * A deep understanding of customer personas and pain points, and a demonstrated ability to address them through thoughtful, customer-first messaging.

postTitle: Customer Success Advisor - APAC (Remote - Work from Anywhere) at Xapo Bank
jobTitle: Customer Success Advisor - APAC (Remote - Work from Anywhere) at Xapo Bank
descContent:
Work from anywhere, impact everywhere

Diversity is at the heart of who we are at Xapo Bank. Weâ€™re a fully
distributed team of over 130 Xapiens that work remotely from 30+ countries
around the world.

Our beginning: A world that enjoys economic freedom and wealth protection, no
matter where you live or who is running your country.

To achieve that, we search the world for the best people for the job. We work
hard, think globally, and inspire each other to learn and grow. We are
committed to changing the way things are done.

_Although we are headquartered in Gibraltar, this is a full time, 100% remote
position  
_ _Work from anywhere!_

**_Position overview_**

As a Customer Success Advisor, you will be supporting members globally.
English fluency is, therefore, required, and additional language(s) is(are) a
plus. Our business is growing fast, and we want to make sure we can keep
providing the best quality service to our members. Weâ€™re known for our fast
response, positive attitude, and a real desire to find the best working
solutions for the people who chose to use Xapoâ€™s products and services. We aim
to provide top-notch service, so we will be expecting you to be quick on your
feet, proactive, and an absolute team player.

**Responsibilities - Member-facing:**

  * Responding to membersâ€™ queries regarding our products and services.
  * Monitoring of member accounts, including debit card transactions, fiat and bitcoin transfers, etc. 
  * Addressing members in a professional, respectful and friendly manner. 
  * Taking ownership of members' issues, following up on outstanding requests, and escalating issues when necessary. 
  * Onboarding of prospective members - assisting them from applying for membership until they are fully onboarded 
  * Conducting Zoom calls to assist prospective members with the onboarding process 
  * Educating prospective members queries regarding our products and services, and conducting Zoom calls when necessary. 

**Responsibilities - Backend**

  * Monitoring of queues in Kustomer to check for prospective members stuck in onboarding process and reaching out to them if necessary 
  * Maintaining of dashboard to provide statistical data ** _  
_**

**_Skills needed_**

  * 2+ years of previous experience in customer services, ideally in a remote environment, handling queries via live chat, and email. 
  * Proficient level of English and, ideally, another additional language (i.e., Mandarin or Japanese). 
  * Ideally, have previous experience working in the fintech/ banking industry. 
  * Experience with CRMs, Jira, Confluence and Slack is nice to have. 
  * Knowledge of the cryptocurrency environment is a big plus. 

**_Other requirements_**

  * A dedicated workspace.
  * A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area.
  * A plain background when on Zoom calls with clients.
  * Smart professional dress code during Zoom calls with clients.
  * Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications.
  * Alignment with Our Values and the Xapo Values-Driven Leadership principles.

**Why work for Xapo?**

IMPACT GLOBALLY, WORK REMOTELY.

  * **Shape the Future:** Improve lives through cutting-edge technology, work 100% remotely from anywhere in the world.
  * **Great work-life balance:** Build amazing things with a balance of autonomy and collaborative teamwork. Set your own work schedule and make use of a flexible PTO plan when you need to recharge.
  * **Expect Excellence:** Collaborate, learn, and grow with a high-performance team. Learn how you learn best - from books to conferences, youâ€™ll get a yearly budget for your individual learning and development goals.

**At Xapo, we prioritize consumer protection and adhere to regulatory
requirements by ensuring that all Xapiens are accountable for upholding
principles of fair treatment, transparency, and ethical conduct in their
interactions with customers and stakeholders.  
**

### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments â€” all in one place, all under
their own brand.

Weâ€™re proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, weâ€™ve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

About the role

We're looking for a Design Engineer: you'll work as design engineer and front-
end prototyper, paired 1:1 with product designers to turn ideas into working
prototypes in hours, not weeks.

Our goal is simple: move from sharing Figma mockups to sharing real, clickable
prototypes as our default design artifact.

You'll bring refined product designs to lifeâ€”building high-fidelity,
functional implementations that bridge design intent and engineering
execution. Your work enables faster validation, clearer stakeholder
communication, and smoother handoff to engineering, with reusable
implementations that raise the quality bar for production builds.

Design owns the output. You'll iterate with designers until the implementation
matches intent, then deploy to preview environments for feedback and review.

This role requires fluency with AI coding tools. We expect you to use tools
like Cursor and Claude Code as your primary way of building, generating fast
starting points and refining them with care.

What youâ€™ll be doing

  * Work daily in tight 1:1 pairing with a product designer, turning Figma concepts into live prototypes in real time
  * Build prototypes in the same technologies as our production front-end (React/Next.js/TypeScript/Tailwind) using Cursor and Claude Code
  * Translate multi-screen Figma flows into working code, collaborating directly with designers throughout iteration
  * Iterate quickly through critique loopsâ€”prototypes are the primary artifact we use to communicate product ideas
  * Leverage the design system as your foundationâ€”building new components only when necessary
  * Deploy to preview environments for async review, feedback, and stakeholder alignment
  * Offer input on technical feasibility and complexity as flows are finalized
  * Manage multiple workstreams, balancing major implementations with quick iteration or refinement needs
  * Collaborate with the product design org while sitting operationally close to the Design Systems and front-end engineering team
What youâ€™ll need to be successful

    * Strong alignment with our values, find our values on our career page if you havenâ€™t read up on them yet.
    * You are proficient in English (spoken, written, and reading) at a [CEFR Level C2](https://magoosh.com/english-speaking/english-proficiency-levels-a-guide-to-determining-your-level/) / [ILR Level 5](https://www.govtilr.org/).

### AI-First Development

      * Hands-on experience using AI coding tools (Cursor and Claude Code) as your primary way of building front-end prototypes
      * You embrace "vibe coding": using AI to generate fast starting points, then refining with precision and care
      * Comfortable iterating quickly with AI assistance while maintaining high visual and functional quality standards

### Technical Foundation

      * 3+ years of experience building web interfaces with React, modern JavaScript, and component-based architecture
      * Strong experience with React, TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind (or very similar modern front-end stack)
      * Strong grasp of React fundamentals (functional components, hooks, props/state) and layout systems (Flexbox, Grid)
      * Experience working with Tailwind CSS and libraries like Radix, Headless UI, or shadcn/ui
      * Comfortable working in a real production-style codebase
      * Familiarity with Git workflows and preview deployments (e.g. Vercel)

### Design-Engineering Bridge

      * Experience translating polished design specs into functional code
      * Comfortable navigating complex Figma filesâ€”extracting assets, understanding auto-layout and component behavior
      * High attention to detail when it comes to visual fidelity, interaction behavior, and polish
      * **You lean design-side for an engineer** : you care about pixels, UX quality, and interaction polish

### Working Style & Profile

      * Exceptional communication skillsâ€”you write clearly, present your work confidently, and collaborate well across disciplines
      * Comfortable working both asynchronously and in real-timeâ€”sharing progress, giving updates, and contributing to team discussions
      * Collaborative and openâ€”you balance design priorities with thoughtful technical input
      * **You might have started as a web designer or have a strong visual/design background** and grew into modern front-end engineering
      * **You've been building small apps, tools, or experiments on your own** using modern front-end stacks and AI coding tools
      * You're constantly exploring new libraries, tools, and workflows to move faster and improve quality

### Bonus points

      * Experience with animation libraries (Framer Motion, CSS transitions)
      * Understanding of accessibility fundamentals (semantic HTML, ARIA, keyboard navigation)
      * Familiarity with other AI-assisted development workflows and tools

### $90,000 - $100,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

      * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
      * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
      * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
      * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
      * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
      * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
      * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
      * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
      * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
      * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
      * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.

in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.â€ To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in

and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and

### **Join Our Team as a Bazel Engineer at Modus Create!**

We are looking for a Bazel Engineer to join our [Scalable Builds
Group](https://www.tweag.io/group/scalable-builds/) and collaborate with
cross-functional teams on build system architecture and consulting for complex
codebases.

### **About You:**

**Experience Level: Senior Level**

  * You are a tinkerer who enjoys digging into challenging problems. You approach complexity with pragmatism, and you're quick to adapt your discoveries to real-world systems.
  * You are an effective communicator empathetic to client needs, thoughtful in your written and verbal communication, and confident in presenting technical work clearly.
  * You bring the mindset of a consultant: confident yet humble, principled yet practical. You bring open-source values into client environments, driving technical direction with clarity and purpose.
  * You have broad exposure to multiple programming languages and platforms, along with hands-on experience with build tools and developer productivity infrastructure.
  * You are eager to deepen your expertise in build systems, especially Bazel, and evolve into a technical leader in this domain, not just in usage but also in infrastructure and architecture.
  * Youâ€™re adaptable, thrive in collaborative environments, and enjoy continuous learning.

If this sounds like you, weâ€™d love to talk!

### **Bonus Points For:**

  * **C++** â€“ having worked with a large C++ codebase and experience with different C++ toolchains (gcc, Clang/LLVM, Visual C++)

### **Nice to have:**

  * **Python** â€“ having worked with a large Python codebase, ideally with type checking in place
  * **TypeScript** â€“ for writing developer tools or managing large-scale frontend/backend projects
  * **Docker** â€“ experience containerizing builds and CI environments

### **Core Responsibilities:**

  * Partner with client teams to modernize their build infrastructure
  * Analyze existing build systems and propose improvements to scalability, reliability, and performance
  * Help migrate legacy systems to Bazel or improve Bazel-based setups
  * Contribute to open source projects related to build tooling (e.g., rules_haskell, rules_nixpkgs, rules_scala)
  * Engage with the Bazel community through blog posts, Slack, mailing lists, and public talks

### **Youâ€™ll Love:**

  * Mentoring and coaching both clients and Modus teammates from the comfort of home.
  * Deep diving into customer needs and translating them into actionable requirements.
  * Exploring new tech and continuously learningâ€”because software is always evolving!
  * Sharing your knowledge and participating actively in the community.

### **Team Collaboration:**

  * Overlap with the US Eastern TimeZone daily is expected.
  * Reliable high-speed internet is a must!

### **Team Culture:**

At Modus, a fast-growing, remote-first company, youâ€™ll experience various
exciting projects! Hereâ€™s a taste of what you might do:

  * **Giving back** : Be an active participant through opportunities such as blog posts, open source contributions, and event speaking.
  * **Travel & connections**: Meet fantastic people during our remote meet-ups! Itâ€™s all about collaboration and fun! Global environment and diversity at its best.
  * **Teaching and learning** : Work in active teams on internal and external projects, staying up-to-date with the latest technologies.
  * **Being a self starter:** Autonomy and proactivity are the key to succeed at Modus.
  * **Client interaction:** Represent Modus and our values while connecting directly with our clients, some of the worldâ€™s biggest brands.
  * **Growth** : Enjoy comprehensive learning benefits, with access to over 12,000 courses. Your growth is our priority!

### **About us:**

Founded in 2011, Modus is a global, fully remote team of world-class
technologists who thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment. We were
fully remote before it was cool! We support organizations on their digital
transformation journey through strategic consulting and full lifecycle product
development, partnering with industry leaders including Atlassian, GitHub and
AWS. Recognized as one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies for
nine years and a top remote work company by FlexJobs, we have helped some of
the worldâ€™s largest brands deliver powerful digital experiences.

**We combine boutique expertise with enterprise-scale capabilities. As a
GitHub partner with a world-class team, we help organizations innovate and
solve complex challenges for Fortune 500 companies and beyond, we want to hear
from you.**

### **Perks of working with us:**

  * Remote work with flexible working hours.
  * Modus Global Office Program: for when you want to get out of your home, we offer on-demand access to private offices, meeting rooms, co-working spaces and business lounges in locations in over 120 countries. 
  * Employee Referral Program.
  * Client Referral Program. 
  * Travel according to client or team needs.
  * The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech.
  * Access to more than 12,000 courses with a licensed Coursera account.
  * Possibility to obtain paid certification/courses if they align with company goals and are relevant to the employee's role.

Additional benefits might apply contingent on your location.  
  
By joining our team, youâ€™ll be part of a winning squad that plays to each
otherâ€™s strengths and celebrates every success together. Apply now and show us
youâ€™ve got what it takes to take your consulting skills to the next level with
Modus Create!

### About the role

Weâ€™re looking for a **Senior Product Marketing Manager, AI** to own product
marketing for Circleâ€™s AI Agents, AI Workflows, AI Copilot, and other emerging
AI-powered capabilities across the platform.

This role sits at the intersection of product innovation, customer education,
and adoption. AI at Circle is not a side feature, itâ€™s a core part of how
communities onboard members, deliver value, automate work, and scale
sustainably. Your job will be to help customers understand whatâ€™s possible,
how to use AI effectively, and why Circleâ€™s approach to AI is meaningfully
different.

Youâ€™ll partner closely with the **Applied AI Product and Engineering org** ,
Growth, and Customer Success to bring new AI capabilities to market, drive
adoption, and shape how Circleâ€™s AI story is told internally and externally.
Youâ€™ll report to the **Head of Product Marketing** and play a critical role in
defining how AI becomes practical, trustworthy, and valuable for our
customers.

This is one of Circleâ€™s most visible and strategically important product
areas.

### What you'll be doing

**Own messaging and positioning for Circleâ€™s AI capabilities.****  
**Define and evolve how we talk about AI Agents, AI Workflows, AI Copilot, and
automation across Circle. Translate powerful technical capabilities into
clear, outcome-driven customer value.

**Drive adoption-focused go-to-market for AI features.****  
**Guide go-to-market strategy for AI launches with a heavy emphasis on
activation, education, and real-world usage. Success in this role is measured
by adoption and impact, not just launch noise.

**Craft high-impact copy and narratives around AI.****  
**Write and oversee AI-related product content across the website, in-product
surfaces, lifecycle campaigns, sales decks, and launch assets. Maintain a high
bar for clarity, accuracy, and brand voice.

**Create customer education and enablement at scale.****  
**Develop guides, examples, templates, workflows, and best practices that help
customers confidently use AI agents and workflows in their communities.

**Enable internal teams on AI positioning and usage.****  
**Work closely with Sales and Customer Success to create enablement materials,
FAQs, demos, and training that help teams explain, sell, and support Circleâ€™s
AI capabilities responsibly and clearly.

**Partner deeply with Product and Engineering.****  
**Stay close to roadmap, technical constraints, and product intent. Influence
product decisions by bringing customer insights, adoption data, and messaging
implications into the development process.

**Champion responsible, trustworthy AI.****  
**Help ensure Circleâ€™s AI messaging is accurate, grounded, and aligned with
customer trust. Avoid hype, overpromising, or vague claims in favor of clarity
and real outcomes.

**Contribute to Circleâ€™s broader product narrative.****  
**Ensure AI fits cohesively into Circleâ€™s overall positioning as a growth
system for serious community businesses.

### What you'll need to be successful

  * Strong alignment with our values. Find our values on our [career page](https://circle.so/careers) if you havenâ€™t read up on them yet.
  * You are proficient in English (spoken, written, and reading) at a [CEFR Level C1](https://magoosh.com/english-speaking/english-proficiency-levels-a-guide-to-determining-your-level/) / [ILR Level 5](https://www.govtilr.org/).
  * 5+ years of product marketing experience, preferably within a high-growth, software company environment, with a strong emphasis on messaging, positioning, and copywriting.
  * 5+ years of product marketing experience, preferably within a high-growth, software company environment, with a strong emphasis on messaging, positioning, and copywriting.
  * A commitment to excellence and craft. We sweat the small details. We obsess over copy, clarity, and consistency. We hold a high bar for how our product and brand show up in the world, and we expect you to do the same.
  * Exceptional written communication skills. You are an excellent writer and editor. In a fully remote, async company, writing is one of your most important tools.
  * Proven ability to create high-impact messaging that resonates with diverse audiences and drives real outcomes, from product adoption to revenue growth.
  * Strong storytelling and simplification skills. Youâ€™re able to take complex product surfaces and translate them into clear, compelling narratives that customers immediately understand and value.
  * Experience crafting positioning frameworks and leading go-to-market strategies for new product launches, working cross-functionally from strategy through execution.
  * A deep understanding of customer personas and pain points, and a demonstrated ability to address them through thoughtful, customer-first messaging.
  * A strong sense of ownership. You take responsibility end-to-end, from defining the problem to shipping the solution and measuring impact. You donâ€™t wait to be told what to do, and you care deeply about the outcomes of your work.
  * A track record of effective cross-functional collaboration with Product, Growth, Sales, and Customer Success to deliver successful launches and campaigns.
  * A strong work ethic and comfort with high expectations. Weâ€™re a fast-growing, venture-backed company with ambitious plans. This role is high-impact and high-accountability, and itâ€™s best suited for someone who thrives in that environment.

### Bonus Points

  * Youâ€™re a growth marketer turned PMM (or have spent meaningful time in growth), and naturally think about messaging in, funnels, experimentation, and how positioning decisions drive real adoption, activation, and revenue impact.
  * Youâ€™ve worked on AI-powered products or surface areas, and know how to bring agents, workflows, or automations to market with clarity, trust, and a focus on real customer value.

### $140,000 - $160,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,

increase on a once per year basis._

    * Proven success designing for conversion, activation, or retention
    * Data literacyâ€”comfortable interpreting funnel performance and experiment results
    * You actively use AI tools to accelerate your design workflow (e.g., research synthesis, UX writing, exploring variants, quick mocks)
    * Experience with AI-assisted tools (e.g., v0, Cursor + Claude Code) when they help you move faster

hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on

postTitle: Technical Writer - Data Analytics at Metabase
jobTitle: Technical Writer - Data Analytics at Metabase
descContent:
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from
tiny startups who get up and running quickly to major corporations with tens
of thousands of users. That's why people [love
us](https://www.metabase.com/love).

  

We bring data tools with the elegance and simplicity of consumer products to
the crufty world of enterprise business intelligence. We provide an
opinionated open source starting point for how companies should measure,
analyze and share their data, which is used by tens of thousands of companies.

  

Technical writers maintain the documentation for Metabase.

Technical writers maintain the documentation for Metabase.

###  What youâ€™ll do

* Work with engineers, product managers, and product designers to create clear, customer-facing documentation for Metabase.
* Collaborate with our Success Engineers to understand how customers think and develop best practices, guides, and tutorials to address customer needs.
* Become a product expert, test new features, and provide product feedback.

### About you

* 3+ years of experience writing docs for technical audiences in data analytics, data engineering, or related fields. 
* Technical expertise in data science or data engineering - youâ€™ll be expected to be a product and domain expert.
* Strong SQL skills.
* Solid understanding of database concepts and data landscape.
* Experience with docs-as-code workflows, Markdown, and Git.

### Nice to have

* Experience with API and SDK documentation.
* Familiarity with Python or JavaScript.
* Strong opinions about docs tooling.

### Why Metabase?

* We take documentation seriously. Our docs are a core part of our product.
* Weâ€™re a startup that operates as a fully remote, async team. There is no office. Work where and when youâ€™re most productive - we trust you to get your work done. Meetings are rare, efficient, and your time is respected.
* Youâ€™ll contribute to a major open-source project used by over 80,000 companies around the world.

**If there's anything more you'd like to tell us about you or your interests,
use the "additional information" section on the application page. We are real
humans looking at applications and we love to hear what you have to say!**

  

We're a global team (50% outside the US), fully distributed (from Thailand to
California), who get things done asynchronously, with plenty of uninterrupted
time, supporting each other to do the best work of our careers. We offer
flexibility (define your own schedule and work from wherever you want),
autonomy, and an environment that fosters growth, learning, and development.
We're relentlessly user-focused and believe in building long-term value, not
short-term hacks. And we raised a $30M Series B to take our approach to the
next level for years to come.

  

For U.S. applicants: Metabase participates in the federal E-Verify program,
which confirms employment authorization of newly hired U.S. based employees.
E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates and is only initiated
upon hire.

  

[E-Verify Participation
Notice](https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/EVerifyParticipationPoster.pdf)
(English/Spanish)

[Right to Work
Notice](https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/IER_RightToWorkPoster%20Eng_Es.pdf)
(English/Spanish)

Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from
tiny startups who get up and running quickly to major corporations with tens
of thousands of users. That's why people [love
us](https://www.metabase.com/love).

  

We bring data tools with the elegance and simplicity of consumer products to
the crufty world of enterprise business intelligence. We provide an
opinionated open source starting point for how companies should measure,
analyze and share their data, which is used by tens of thousands of companies.

postTitle: AI Platform Engineer, Applied AI at Circle
jobTitle: AI Platform Engineer, Applied AI at Circle
descContent:
### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments â€” all in one place, all under
their own brand.

Weâ€™re proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, weâ€™ve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

### About the role

The Applied AI team at Circle is at the forefront of leveraging AI to drive
innovation for our customers through transformative applications of large
language models (LLMs). We build AI-powered features for our customers â€” AI
agents, AI workflows, and AI copilot. As we scale these features to more
customers, we're investing in robust infrastructure for measuring, diagnosing,
and improving AI system speed and performance.

We're looking for a strong AI Platform Engineer to help establish the
foundation for this layer. This is a new focus area for us, with this being
the first AI platform engineer hire at Circle. Youâ€™ll have significant
ownership in shaping how we approach it. This role focuses on production AI
systems â€” building infrastructure to measure and improve themâ€” rather than ML
research or model training. If you're excited about making AI systems work
reliably at scale, this is for you.

You'll build evaluation frameworks, observability tooling, and diagnostic
infrastructure that tells us whether our AI systems are working well and helps
identify where and how to improve them. When you find gaps, you'll prototype
solutions, validate them with data, and work with the team to implement these
improvements.

### What you'll be doing

  * Build evaluation infrastructure to measure AI system speed and accuracy â€” both offline (during development) and online (in production).
  * Create observability tooling and dashboards that surface quality metrics week-over-week.
  * Diagnose quality gaps. When accuracy drops, trace whether it's retrieval, ranking, prompting, or something else causing the issue.
  * Experiment with different models and agent configurations, using data to guide decisions.
  * Prototype and validate improvements to our RAG pipeline â€” chunking strategies, retrieval methods, re-ranking approaches.
  * Analyze how our customers are using our AI features to help us identify improvements or new areas for development.
  * Work closely with other engineers to give them confidence that their changes improve quality.
  * Help us stay up-to-date with the cutting-edge AI research, techniques, and tools.

### What you'll need to be successful

  * Experience building and evaluating AI systems in production â€” including RAG pipelines, search / retrieval systems, LLM-powered applications, and both offline and LLM-based evaluation frameworks.
  * Strong proficiency in **Python** for prototyping and experimentation.
  * Openness to learning **Ruby on Rails** â€” our production system is built in Rails, and you'll need to integrate with and instrument the existing codebase.
  * Comfortable building infrastructure and tooling (eval pipelines, dashboards, data processing).
  * Deep understanding of RAG architecture: chunking strategies, embeddings, retrieval, re-ranking, context management.
  * Strong experimentation mindset â€” youâ€™re comfortable designing and running A/B tests, measuring results, and iterating quickly to discover what works and what doesnâ€™t.
  * Strong data analysis skills â€” you can interpret results, identify patterns, and communicate findings clearly.
  * A desire to work in an environment which values speed of iteration and individual autonomy, while also embracing personal accountability and the ability to collaborate effectively as part of a dynamic team.
  * Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a certain level of ambiguity, especially when learning and picking up new technologies when projects require it.
  * Strong alignment with our values, [**find our values on our career page**](https://circle.so/careers) if you havenâ€™t read up on them yet.
  * You are proficient in English (spoken, written, and reading) at a [**CEFR Level C2**](https://magoosh.com/english-speaking/english-proficiency-levels-a-guide-to-determining-your-level/) / [**ILR Level 5**](https://www.govtilr.org/).

### Bonus Points

  * Experience with evaluation frameworks (Braintrust, LangSmith, or similar).

### $130,000 - $140,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

  * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
  * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
  * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
  * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
  * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
  * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
  * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
  * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
  * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
  * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
Hereâ€™s how our CEO, Sid Yadav, frames our hiring mission: â€œletâ€™s find talent
in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.â€ To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on
the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by
applicable laws. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment
process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in
accordance with the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** in the EU
and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the
types of personal information we collect, the purpose for collecting it, and
your rights.

**Information We Collect:** We collect the following categories of personal
information from job applicants:

  * Contact information (such as name, email address, phone number)
  * Employment history and qualifications
  * Education history
  * References and any other information you choose to share with us during the application process

**Purpose of Collection:** We collect this information for the following
purposes:

  * To assess your qualifications and suitability for the position
  * To communicate with you during the recruitment process
  * To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

**Your Rights Under GDPR and CCPA:** You have the following rights regarding
your personal information:

  * The right to request access to the personal information we hold about you.
  * The right to request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain legal exceptions.
  * The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information (Note: We do not sell personal information).

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise
your rights, please refer to our full [Privacy
Policy](https://circle.so/privacy).

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and
understood this privacy notice.

descContent:
### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around

more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

About the role

We're looking for a Lead Product Designer for Applied AI at Circle.

You'll design AI-native experiencesâ€”agents that act on behalf of community
managers, workflows that reduce manual work, and a copilot that helps creators
run their communities more effectively.

You'll work with our Applied AI engineering team to turn AI capabilities into
real workflows and product experiences for our customers. You'll own the
design direction for Applied AI surfaces across Circle.

These aren't typical product design challenges. You'll make AI behavior
legible, build trust in non-deterministic systems, and give users meaningful
control without overwhelming them. You'll shape how creators and AI
collaborate inside Circle.

You'll be joining a design team where context is shared openly, ownership is
real, and talented people are trusted to do their best work.

What youâ€™ll be doing

  * Own the design strategy for Applied AI surfaces, from discovery through shipped experiences
  * Provide thought leadership for Applied AI at Circle: stay on top of AI and UX trends and drive our direction in this area
  * Operate with high autonomy: you identify opportunities, frame the problem, and drive from 0â†’1 with minimal guidance
  * Act as a peer to Product and Engineering on product decisions, not just a downstream executor
  * Design end-to-end AI experiencesâ€”from initial concept to launchâ€”including agents, workflows, and copilot features
  * Define patterns for AI-assisted and AI-automated actions: triggering, monitoring, correcting, and building user trust
  * Tackle novel UX problems around transparency, control, and error handling for unpredictable systems
  * Prototype and test AI-powered flows and interactions quickly with users
  * Collaborate closely with engineers and design engineers using Cursor and Claude Code to turn your concepts into working experiences
  * Work embedded with engineering and ML teams, iterating as capabilities evolve
What youâ€™ll need to be successful

    * Strong alignment with our values, find our values on our career page if you havenâ€™t read up on them yet.
    * You are proficient in English (spoken, written, and reading) at a [CEFR Level C2](https://magoosh.com/english-speaking/english-proficiency-levels-a-guide-to-determining-your-level/) / [ILR Level 5](https://www.govtilr.org/).
    * 6+ years of product design experience with a strong portfolio demonstrating UX and visual craft
    * You already use AI deeply in your design work todayâ€”you can explain concretely how AI is integrated into your workflows (research, exploration, prototyping, content, visuals)
    * Hands-on experience with AI-assisted prototyping tools (e.g., v0, Lovable, Cursor + Claude Code)
    * Experience designing AI-powered tools, conversational interfaces, automation systems, or similarly complex products
    * Strong prototyping skillsâ€”you build clickable, realistic prototypes yourself, not just static screens
    * Proficiency in Figma for high-fidelity design and collaboration
    * Exceptional written and verbal communication skillsâ€”able to clearly explain complex ideas, influence decisions, and align teams asynchronously
    * Comfortable designing in ambiguity and solving problems without existing patterns
    * Attention to detail that results in polished, shippable work

### $140,000 - $170,000 USD per year

_We are hiring at a Lead level for this role; however, we may consider
offering this position at the Senior level depending on a candidateâ€™s
experience level alignment with the role. In either case, the offer would fall
within the published compensation range._

### The fun stuff

      * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
      * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
      * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.

      * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
      * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
      * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
      * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
      * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
      * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
      * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
