postTitle: Product Inventor / Engineer @ Fun Ecom Co | Great People & Flexible Hours
jobTitle: Product Inventor / Engineer @ Fun Ecom Co | Great People & Flexible Hours
descContent:
\- Do you see crappy products everywhere and think "I could make that so much
better"?

\- Does your brain refuse to stop solving problems, even when you're supposed
to be relaxing?

\- Do you thrive in a high-stress environment filled with political
infighting, bureaucracy, and corporate nonsense?

****

If so, then we are the place for you, except you might hate how nice of a
company we have - filled with happy, generally competent people that donâ€™t put
up with jerks. Frankly, it makes me sick how nice everyone is.

****

We are remote full time, have very flexible hours, people are judged by their
output, not by how much they suck up to the boss, and turnover is super low
because the company believes that happy employees = happy customers = happy
bank account. Simply disgusting, if you ask me.

****

\--Is this a real job ad?--

Yup! Amazingly enough, we actually paid money to post this on a bunch of
different job sites. And itâ€™s not even a pyramid scheme! Plus, get this: the
owner just started paying our 70ish employees with money instead of Pizza Hut
coupons - weâ€™re big time, people.

****

Our careers page is actually worth checking out to learn more about how insane
we are (sidenote: it won a web design award in 1993 - weâ€™re a pretty big
deal):

****

<http://www.jlstradingco.com/careers/>

****

And check out our reviews on
[Google](https://www.google.com/search?q=JLS+Trading+Co%20Charlotte,%20NC),
[Glassdoor](https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-JLS-Trading-
EI_IE1949817.11,22.htm), or [Indeed](https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Jls-Trading-
Co) to see that itâ€™s not just the founderâ€™s mother who says weâ€™re cool.

****

\--What do you guys do?--

We do a lot of different things these days including selling awesome consumer
products (these are just a small sampling):

****

\- Bad Parking Cards (<https://amz.run/5Eya>)

\- Beverage Barricades (<https://amz.run/6kip>)

\- Child Chucker (<https://amz.run/9EUz>)

****

Running this Amazon Pay-Per-Click agency: PPCFarm.com (weâ€™re really, really
good at PPC)

****

And we will soon be launching a SaaS product for inventory management.

****

We are doing our best to grow rapidly every year, and itâ€™s our intention to
continue that for as long as possible, which means we need good people to help
us keep up with the growth.

****

\--What is your company like?--

1\. You Can Be Yourself. You donâ€™t have to put on a fake, professional face.
You can just be yourself. You can talk smack to the CEO (highly encouraged),
and no one will think anything of it. You don't have to dress up, or use
formal language, or pretend to be something you're not - you can just be you.

****

2\. Major Opportunities for Career Growth. We are not trying to just be a
small business. We plan to be doing $100 million annually in the next few
years. We promote quickly once we identify talent. It doesnâ€™t matter what your
credentials are â€“ it matters what you get done.

****

3\. Full Time Remote/Flexible Hours. You will be working from home in your
pajamas, on your schedule. And we donâ€™t care if you work 10 hour days 4 days a
week or 6 hours a day and catch up over the weekend. So long as you get a lot
of work done, weâ€™re happy campers.

****

4\. Complete Work/Life Balance. If youâ€™re routinely working more than 45ish
hours, youâ€™re gonna get a friendly talking-to. We want you to be operating at
100% capacity, which means that you need to rest.

****

5\. Strongly Anti-BS. Anybody in the company can (and is expected to) tell the
CEO when he is wrong. There are no bureaucratic or BS rules getting in the way
of getting work done.

****

6\. No Micro-Management. Once youâ€™re trained and have demonstrated you know
your stuff, we are pretty hands-off. In fact, if you need external management
to stay on-task and motivated, we probably arenâ€™t the place for you.

****

7\. No Toxic/Incompetent People Allowed. We try very hard to screen out mean
or stupid people before they get in, but in case they slip through, we fire
them quickly. You will never have to interact with someone who is an obvious
idiot or straight up malicious. No toxic or incompetent people at work - could
it really be? [Yes]

****

8\. Supportive Environment. We donâ€™t operate via intense stress or
unreasonable top-down deadlines. Everyone wants you to be successful â€“
internal politics are at a minimum here.

****

9\. Lots of Raises. We do our absolute best to get ahead of things and give
raises preemptively, so you don't have to ask for one. It's not unusual at all
for someone to receive 2+ raises per year.

****

10\. Weâ€™ll Invest in Your Training. We want you and everyone to get better
constantly. Youâ€™ll be learning new things all the time, and are strongly
encouraged to invest time every day to learn new things, improve your
system/work process, and just generally try to make your life easier.

****

11\. 4-6+ Weeks Vacation. We 100% want you to recharge, so having plenty of
time off is absolutely worth it.

****

12\. Paid Maternity/Paternity Leave. Weâ€™ve even started letting people skip
meetings during labor!

****

13\. Self-Funded So We Can Do Whatâ€™s Right for Us. We donâ€™t have to answer to
anyone but ourselves, so we can make the right decision for the long-term
health of the company vs trying to get big too fast or cut corners to appease
some selfish investor.

****

\--What are your companyâ€™s values?--

See here: <http://www.jlstradingco.com/careers/>

****

Yes, those are legitimately our values. The careers page is definitely worth
checking out - itâ€™s not just normal corporate BS. We promise youâ€™ll learn a
lot about us.

****

\--OK, so Iâ€™ve read like 8 dang pages about you guys. Will you tell me what
the actual job is?--

No.

****

\--Wait... What?--

OK fine. Super short version:

****

Inventing remarkable consumer products - taking concepts from "this should
exist" to "holy shit, why didn't this exist before" - in the kitchen and
household space.

Bulleted Responsibilities:

  * Take product concepts and figure out how to make them work elegantly

  * Design products in CAD (we use SolidWorks, but we're flexible on software)

  * Prototype heavily in-house (3D printing, testing, breaking, improving, repeat)

  * Iterate relentlessly until the product hits our "remarkable" quality threshold

  * Collaborate with our supply chain team on Design for Manufacturing and sourcing decisions

  * Deliver production-ready CAD files and specifications for manufacturing

  * Solve hard problems that don't have obvious solutions (this is like 80% of the job)

To give you an idea of what we make: Beverage Barricades (the magnetic drink
guard), CrocoDicer, and various kitchen gadgets that make people's lives
meaningfully better. We're not making generic private label crap - we're
inventing things that are genuinely novel and patentable.

Fair warning: this is slow, deliberate work. A single product might take 6-36
months from concept to launch. We are quality-obsessed and refuse to ship
mediocre products. If you need the dopamine hit of shipping something every
week, you will be miserable here.

Like everyone else in the company, you will also need to innovate regularly -
which means figuring out ways to improve quality and production speed.

****

It is challenging, but fun work thatâ€™s going to require a lot of time and task
management, problem-solving, and a reasonable amount of people skills.

****

\--Do I need a college degree?--

You just need to be awesome.

****

\--Are there any geographic restrictions?--

As long as you are in a country that doesnâ€™t have active sanctions from the US
government, we are interested. Our founder isnâ€™t known for respecting the
government much, but they have all the guns, soâ€¦

****

\--Do I need an engineering degree?--

Nope. Our current product engineer is largely self-taught and didn't go to
engineering school. We don't care about credentials - we care about whether
you can actually invent great products. If you can demonstrate strong CAD
skills and a track record of making things, that matters way more than a
diploma.

****

\--What CAD software do you use?--

We currently use SolidWorks, but we're not religious about it. What matters is
that you can produce production-ready 3D models. If you're proficient in
Fusion 360, AutoCAD, or similar - that's fine. Just know that you'll need to
come in with strong 3D modeling skills; we're not training from zero.

****

\--How many products will I work on at once?--

Typically 1-2 at a time. This is deep focus work, not juggling a dozen things.
You'll spend months on a single product, iterating until it's genuinely great.

****

\--What if I've never worked in consumer products before?--

That's fine, as long as you have demonstrated ability to design and prototype
physical products. Whether that came from industrial design, mechanical
engineering, or just being a maker who builds stuff in your garage - we care
about the skill, not the pedigree.

****

\--Do I need to deal with manufacturers directly?--

You'll collaborate with our supply chain team on Design for Manufacturing and
be involved in sourcing decisions, but you won't own the vendor relationships.
Supply chain handles the day-to-day communication with factories. Your job is
to design products that can actually be manufactured.

****

\--What does a typical day look like?--

Variable as hell. Some days you're deep in CAD. Some days you're running
prototype tests. Some days you're researching materials or competitor
products. Very few meetings. Basically no bureaucracy. What's consistent is
working independently, solving hard problems, and pushing toward "remarkable."

****

\--6-36 months per product? Really?--

Really. We iterate until it's genuinely great. We'd rather take 2 years to
launch something remarkable than rush out something mediocre in 3 months. If
that timeline makes you anxious, this probably isn't the role for you.

****

\--What types of products will I be working on?--

Primarily kitchen and household products. Things that solve real problems
people have. We're especially interested in products that can be patented and
are hard for competitors to copy. Generally, we want to either radically
improve a product in its category (like 200% better) or invent a new category.

****

\--This sounds pretty good, though Iâ€™m still skeptical that this isnâ€™t a
pyramid scheme.--

You sound just like the tax authorities!

****

\--That doesnâ€™t resolve any of my fears, but what do I need to do to apply?--

Please submit your information on the following page to apply. We promise to
respond within 5-10 business days even if our answer is No.

****

There will be multiple steps in this process, FYI, including a long written
application, interviews with potentially a few different people, and paid work
test(s). Hiring the right people is really hard and very expensive if we do it
poorly, so we have to front-load the process. I'm sorry about that and thank
you for sticking with us.

****

Once youâ€™re in our pipeline though, I would anticipate giving you a final
answer within a few weeks, depending on how it goes. We definitely donâ€™t want
to string you along, and as long as you do what we ask, we promise to tell you
â€œyesâ€ or â€œnoâ€, and to not just ghost you (like everybody I match with on
Tinder).

****

Thank you for your time and interest, and I hope we can work together soon!

* * *

As an Development Manager at Awesome Motive, you'll join the WPForms team as a
hands-on technical leader who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty. This is
not your typical management role - we're looking for someone who thrives as
both a leader and an individual contributor.

We are looking for an Development Manager who can seamlessly switch between
writing production code, architecting solutions, and leading a team of
talented developers. You'll be expected to maintain individual contributions
while also driving team excellence, mentoring developers, and ensuring our
WordPress plugins deliver exceptional quality to millions of users worldwide.

**This is a hybrid role where you'll spend approximately 40-50% of your time
on hands-on technical work and 50-60% on leadership and management
responsibilities**. You are equally comfortable doing both and adjusting the
split based on the number of direct/indirect reports. We need someone who
demonstrates extreme ownership, operates with high agency, and takes full
accountability for both team outcomes and individual deliverables.

The ideal candidate doesn't just manage work - they do the work. You'll be in
the codebase daily, leading by example, and setting and maintaining the high
technical bar. You should be comfortable jumping into complex problems,
writing code alongside your team, and making technical decisions with
confidence and autonomy while maintaining a high degree of collaboration with
the Product Manager.

**Interested in applying?**

**Please read/follow the next steps outlined in "How to Apply" at the bottom
of this listing.  
**

_Attention to detail is one of our[core
values](https://awesomemotive.com/core-values/)_ _! This is your chance to
stand out :)  
_

### To love this role, hereâ€™s the type of person you are:

  * You embody **extreme ownership** \- when something needs to be done, you take charge and deliver results.
  * You operate with **high agency** \- you identify problems, create solutions, and execute without constant oversight.
  * You're a **player-coach** who leads from the front, and by example.
  * You're an excellent communicator, fluent in both verbal and written English, who ensures transparency and clarity in all interactions.
  * You take pride in both your individual contributions and your team's success - you measure yourself by both metrics.
  * You mentor through pair programming and code reviews, not only meetings and presentations.
  * You can give and receive critical feedback constructively and act on it quickly.
  * You're passionate about building both great products and great teams.
  * You are more than capable of leading Teams of Teams.

### Common responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

**Leadership (50-60% of your time)** :

  * Lead, mentor, and develop a team of developers through hands-on collaboration.
  * Facilitate technical discussions.
  * Remove blockers and shield the team from distractions while maintaining productivity.
  * Drive hiring decisions and help build a world-class engineering team.
  * Establish and maintain development processes that enable high-velocity delivery.
  * Collaborate with Product, QA, and Design teams to ensure alignment.
  * Take full ownership of team deliverables and deadlines - no excuses.
  * Foster a culture of extreme ownership and high agency within your team.

**Technical leadership (40-50% of your time)** :

  * Write production-quality code for critical features and complex problems.
  * Architect technical solutions and make key technical decisions.
  * Ability to evaluate, implement, and establish best practices for AI tools adoption to enhance team productivity while maintaining code ownership and security standards.
  * Lead by example through hands-on coding, debugging, and problem-solving.
  * Perform code reviews and ensure code quality standards are exceeded.
  * Optimize performance and scalability for millions of WordPress users.
  * Drive technical excellence through direct contribution to the codebase.
  * Prepare and review technical design documents (Pitches) for major features.
  * Troubleshoot and resolve the most challenging technical issues through direct involvement.

## Requirements

**Technical Requirements**

  * Proven work experience in web development, 7+ years.
  * Hands-on engineering leadership experience, 3+ years.
  * Strong proficiency in PHP (modern PHP 7+/8+), 5+ years.
  * Experience with Laravel or other modern PHP frameworks.
  * Experience leveraging AI-powered coding assistants to accelerate development workflows and improve code quality across the team.
  * Extensive experience with WordPress plugin development, 4+ years.
  * Expert-level understanding of JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3.
  * Deep experience with MySQL, database optimization, and scaling.
  * Mastery of software design patterns, SOLID principles, and clean architecture.
  * Proven track record of shipping production code regularly while in a leadership role.
  * Experience with Git workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and DevOps practices.
  * Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
  * Strong experience with RESTful APIs and third-party integrations.
  * Demonstrated ability to debug and solve complex technical problems independently.

**Leadership Requirements**

  * Proven experience leading engineering teams while maintaining individual contribution.
  * Track record of mentoring developers and improving team capabilities.
  * Ability to make autonomous decisions and take full accountability for outcomes.
  * Experience balancing technical debt with feature delivery.
  * Ability to manage special projects while maintaining a high level of collaboration with the Project Management function.
  * Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth environments.
  * Ability to keep complex ideas and features simple. (Simplicity is a core value!)
  * English at the upper intermediate level or higher.
  * Experience leading fully remote, distributed teams.

**Basic Requirements**

  * Personal Computer with Internet Access.
  * Availability to participate in audio/video meetings between 9am and 5pm ET.

**Bonus points if you also have:**

  * Experience with React, Vue.js, or other modern JavaScript frameworks.
  * Experience scaling WordPress to handle millions of users.
  * Track record of significant open-source contributions or WordPress core contributions.
  * Experience with microservices and distributed systems.
  * Background in SaaS platforms and subscription-based products.
  * Experience with performance optimization at scale.
  * Experience integrating AI/ML features into WordPress plugins or SaaS products.
  * Previous experience in a player-coach role at a high-growth company.
  * Track record of building and scaling engineering teams from scratch.

## Benefits

Working for a fast-growing bootstrapped company is a rare opportunity, one we
consider a lifestyle choice rather than a job choice. Our positions are
challenging, but also come with amazing advantages and fulfillment to those
who earn them. Hereâ€™s what we offer.

  * Competitive Salary.
  * Term Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment for all full-time team members during their employment.
  * Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance benefits for full-time U.S. employees.
  * Health Insurance benefits for all employees in Argentina, Brazil, India, Indonesia, Jamaica, Kenya, Mexico, Nepal, Nigeria, Pakistan, Philippines, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Spain, and Ukraine.
  * Work from your home. Weâ€™re spread out all over the world â€“ United States, Canada, Ukraine, India, Pakistan, Singapore, and more.
  * Flexible PTO after 90 days of employment. We encourage employees to take the time they need for a vacation, stay healthy, and spend time with friends and family.
  * Holidays (based on your location)
  * Paid Parental Leave.
  * We happily provide or reimburse software youâ€™ll need as well as books or courses that promote continued learning.
  * We cover all costs of company travel (including our annual all-company retreat and mini-team meetups).
  * Additional Perks include AM Welcome Box for new team members, Yearly Anniversary Gifts, and Technology Stipend each work anniversary.
  * We give you the opportunity to solve challenging and meaningful problems that make a difference.
  * Ability to work with some of the best people in the business through frequent, if not daily, interactions.
  * And in case you were wondering: no politics, no b.s., and no jerks.

**Location  
** This is a remote position - our team is spread around the globe! Our home
base is in Florida, USA, so company operating hours are 9am - 5pm ET (UTC -5).
While full coverage is not a requirement, you must be available during a
portion of the day.

**Inclusion Statement  
** At Awesome Motive, we strive to have the broadest possible view of
diversity, going beyond visible differences to include the background,
experiences, skills, and perspectives that make each person unique. Awesome
Motive is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal
employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex,
national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status,
disability, gender identity, veteran status, or any other basis protected by
federal, state, or local law.

**How to apply?  
** If all of this sounds interesting, then please submit your application!

**Please clearly include the following in your cover letter:**

  * Please clearly include the following in your cover letter:
  * Describe a time when you demonstrated extreme ownership by taking charge of a critical situation without being asked. What was the outcome?
  * Tell us about the most complex technical problem you've personally solved while in a leadership role.
  * Have you led any major technology migrations, platform upgrades, or system modernizations? Briefly describe
  * Tell us about a time where you had to make trade-offs between shipping speed and shipping the perfect solution - what compromises did you make?
  * Share an example of a high-agency decision you made that significantly impacted your team or product.
  * Describe a time when you had to make a difficult product or technical decision autonomously. How did you approach it?
  * Links to your GitHub profile showing recent commits, portfolio, or any open-source contributions.

**Alongside your cover letter, we would also really appreciate a 2-minute
video introducing yourself and answering the following questions:**

  * Tell us a bit about yourself and why you should be considered the top candidate for this position. Details about your experience (especially WordPress), qualifications, personality, etc., are very helpful.
  * What percentage of your time do you currently spend writing code vs. managing? What's your ideal ratio?

Also note, don't forget to proofread before submitting. Check spelling,
capitalization, etc. This is your chance to make your application stand out :)

We wonâ€™t be able to individually respond to all applications, but if we feel
youâ€™re a strong match, someone will be in touch shortly.

**Thanks and we look forward to hearing from you!**

* * *

postTitle: Software Engineering Manager - Database, Senior Test Tooling Engineer, Database Support Engineer, Customer Delivery Engineer, Senior/Staff Product Manager, AI
jobTitle: Software Engineering Manager - Database, Senior Test Tooling Engineer, Database Support Engineer, Customer Delivery Engineer, Senior/Staff Product Manager, AI
descContent:
Tiger Data (FKA Timescale) [ Global | 100% Remote | Multiple Roles: Eng, Product, Support + more ]

We began in 2017 as TimescaleDB, focused on making PostgreSQL the best
database for time-series data. As our customers evolved, so did we.

Today, more than 2,000 companies use our technology to power real-time
analytics, agentic applications, and high-ingest operational systems. What
started as a time-series database has become the fastest PostgreSQL for modern
workloads. To reflect that evolution, weâ€™re now TigerDataâ€”a name that speaks
to our speed, precision, and ambition. The tiger has long been part of our
culture: fast, focused, powerful. From â€œTiger Timeâ€ all-hands to welcoming new
hires as â€œtiger cubs,â€ itâ€™s how we buildâ€”decisively, fearlessly, and with
purpose.

This is not a reinvention: itâ€™s a reflection of how we already serve our
customers today.

TigerData is growing! Check us out: <https://www.tigerdata.com/careers>

Software Engineering Manager - Database -
[https://www.tigerdata.com/careers/08ddff61-b67a-42c5-a799-2e...](https://www.tigerdata.com/careers/08ddff61-b67a-42c5-a799-2e1f49c72ddc)

postTitle: Crypto Trading Trainee Market Analysis Associate
jobTitle: Crypto Trading Trainee Market Analysis Associate
descContent:
WhiteBridge Ltd is an international, fast-growing company operating in the
digital asset and market analytics space. We create an environment where
motivated newcomers can gain hands-on experience and grow into professional
crypto market specialists.

We are looking for an entry-level candidate who is eager to learn, work with
real market data, and develop trading skills under the guidance of experienced
mentors.

### Key Responsibilities

  * Assist in executing trading operations on cryptocurrency markets.
  * Monitor price movements, volume changes, and overall market behavior.
  * Record and maintain transaction data and performance metrics.
  * Analyze charts, market data, and news to support trading decisions.
  * Work with analytical platforms and collaborate with the trading team.
  * Gradually build and refine your own trading strategy.

### What We Offer

  * Opportunity to join a young, international, and growing company.
  * Fully remote work â€” location independent.
  * Flexible schedule up to 20 hours per week, ideal to combine with studies or other commitments.
  * Structured training from scratch with continuous mentor support.
  * Clear career growth path and transition to more advanced roles.

### Ideal Candidate Profile

  * Strong interest in cryptocurrency markets, blockchain, or financial trading (experience not required).
  * Willingness to learn fast, adapt, and develop new skills from the ground up.
  * High attention to detail and accuracy when working with data and real market operations.
  * Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment.
  * Responsible, reliable, and committed to completing tasks.
  * Motivated to grow professionally within the company.
  * English level B2 or higher â€” required to work with analytics, tools, and international news sources.

Please mention the word **SPONTANEOUS** when applying to show you read the job
post completely (#RMjQwNzphYTgwOjEyNjpiZDkwOjFjMGM6YTkyZTpkMDBhOjJhNDM=). This
is a feature to avoid fake spam applicants. Companies can search these words
to find applicants that read this and instantly see they're human.  
  

## Salary and compensation

  
$70,000 â€” $90,000/year  
  

## Benefits

ğŸ¥§ Pay in crypto

postTitle: Product Inventor Engineer @ Fun Ecom Co
jobTitle: Product Inventor Engineer @ Fun Ecom Co
descContent:
\- Do you see crappy products everywhere and think "I could make that so much
better"?

\- Does your brain refuse to stop solving problems, even when you're supposed
to be relaxing?

\- Do you thrive in a high-stress environment filled with political
infighting, bureaucracy, and corporate nonsense?

**  
**

If so, then we are the place for you, except you might hate how nice of a
company we have - filled with happy, generally competent people that donâ€™t put
up with jerks. Frankly, it makes me sick how nice everyone is.

**  
**

We are remote full time, have very flexible hours, people are judged by their
output, not by how much they suck up to the boss, and turnover is super low
because the company believes that happy employees = happy customers = happy
bank account. Simply disgusting, if you ask me.

**  
**

\--Is this a real job ad?--

Yup! Amazingly enough, we actually paid money to post this on a bunch of
different job sites. And itâ€™s not even a pyramid scheme! Plus, get this: the
owner just started paying our 70ish employees with money instead of Pizza Hut
coupons - weâ€™re big time, people.

**  
**

Our careers page is actually worth checking out to learn more about how insane
we are (sidenote: it won a web design award in 1993 - weâ€™re a pretty big
deal):

**  
**

<http://www.jlstradingco.com/careers/>

**  
**

And check out our reviews
on[Google](https://www.google.com/search?q=JLS+Trading+Co%20Charlotte,%20NC),
[Glassdoor](https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-JLS-Trading-
EI_IE1949817.11,22.htm), or [Indeed](https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Jls-Trading-
Co) to see that itâ€™s not just the founderâ€™s mother who says weâ€™re cool.

**  
**

\--What do you guys do?--

We do a lot of different things these days including selling awesome consumer
products (these are just a small sampling):

**  
**

\- Bad Parking Cards (<https://amz.run/5Eya>)

\- Beverage Barricades (<https://amz.run/6kip>)

\- Child Chucker (<https://amz.run/9EUz>)

**  
**

Running this Amazon Pay-Per-Click agency: PPCFarm.com (weâ€™re really, really
good at PPC)

**  
**

And we will soon be launching a SaaS product for inventory management.

**  
**

We are doing our best to grow rapidly every year, and itâ€™s our intention to
continue that for as long as possible, which means we need good people to help
us keep up with the growth.

**  
**

\--What is your company like?--

1\. You Can Be Yourself. You donâ€™t have to put on a fake, professional face.
You can just be yourself. You can talk smack to the CEO (highly encouraged),
and no one will think anything of it. You don't have to dress up, or use
formal language, or pretend to be something you're not - you can just be you.

**  
**

2\. Major Opportunities for Career Growth. We are not trying to just be a
small business. We plan to be doing $100 million annually in the next few
years. We promote quickly once we identify talent. It doesnâ€™t matter what your
credentials are â€“ it matters what you get done.

**  
**

3\. Full Time Remote/Flexible Hours. You will be working from home in your
pajamas, on your schedule. And we donâ€™t care if you work 10 hour days 4 days a
week or 6 hours a day and catch up over the weekend. So long as you get a lot
of work done, weâ€™re happy campers.

**  
**

4\. Complete Work/Life Balance. If youâ€™re routinely working more than 45ish
hours, youâ€™re gonna get a friendly talking-to. We want you to be operating at
100% capacity, which means that you need to rest.

**  
**

5\. Strongly Anti-BS. Anybody in the company can (and is expected to) tell the
CEO when he is wrong. There are no bureaucratic or BS rules getting in the way
of getting work done.

**  
**

6\. No Micro-Management. Once youâ€™re trained and have demonstrated you know
your stuff, we are pretty hands-off. In fact, if you need external management
to stay on-task and motivated, we probably arenâ€™t the place for you.

**  
**

7\. No Toxic/Incompetent People Allowed. We try very hard to screen out mean
or stupid people before they get in, but in case they slip through, we fire
them quickly. You will never have to interact with someone who is an obvious
idiot or straight up malicious. No toxic or incompetent people at work - could
it really be? [Yes]

**  
**

8\. Supportive Environment. We donâ€™t operate via intense stress or
unreasonable top-down deadlines. Everyone wants you to be successful â€“
internal politics are at a minimum here.

**  
**

9\. Lots of Raises. We do our absolute best to get ahead of things and give
raises preemptively, so you don't have to ask for one. It's not unusual at all
for someone to receive 2+ raises per year.

**  
**

10\. Weâ€™ll Invest in Your Training. We want you and everyone to get better
constantly. Youâ€™ll be learning new things all the time, and are strongly
encouraged to invest time every day to learn new things, improve your
system/work process, and just generally try to make your life easier.

**  
**

11\. 4-6+ Weeks Vacation. We 100% want you to recharge, so having plenty of
time off is absolutely worth it.

**  
**

12\. Paid Maternity/Paternity Leave. Weâ€™ve even started letting people skip
meetings during labor!

**  
**

13\. Self-Funded So We Can Do Whatâ€™s Right for Us. We donâ€™t have to answer to
anyone but ourselves, so we can make the right decision for the long-term
health of the company vs trying to get big too fast or cut corners to appease
some selfish investor.

**  
**

\--What are your companyâ€™s values?--

See here: <http://www.jlstradingco.com/careers/>

**  
**

Yes, those are legitimately our values. The careers page is definitely worth
checking out - itâ€™s not just normal corporate BS. We promise youâ€™ll learn a
lot about us.

**  
**

\--OK, so Iâ€™ve read like 8 dang pages about you guys. Will you tell me what
the actual job is?--

No.

**  
**

\--Wait... What?--

OK fine. Super short version:

**  
**

Inventing remarkable consumer products - taking concepts from "this should
exist" to "holy shit, why didn't this exist before" - in the kitchen and
household space.

Bulleted Responsibilities:

  * Take product concepts and figure out how to make them work elegantly

  * Design products in CAD (we use SolidWorks, but we're flexible on software)

  * Prototype heavily in-house (3D printing, testing, breaking, improving, repeat)

  * Iterate relentlessly until the product hits our "remarkable" quality threshold

  * Collaborate with our supply chain team on Design for Manufacturing and sourcing decisions

  * Deliver production-ready CAD files and specifications for manufacturing

  * Solve hard problems that don't have obvious solutions (this is like 80% of the job)

To give you an idea of what we make: Beverage Barricades (the magnetic drink
guard), CrocoDicer, and various kitchen gadgets that make people's lives
meaningfully better. We're not making generic private label crap - we're
inventing things that are genuinely novel and patentable.

Fair warning: this is slow, deliberate work. A single product might take 6-36
months from concept to launch. We are quality-obsessed and refuse to ship
mediocre products. If you need the dopamine hit of shipping something every
week, you will be miserable here.

Like everyone else in the company, you will also need to innovate regularly -
which means figuring out ways to improve quality and production speed.

**  
**

It is challenging, but fun work thatâ€™s going to require a lot of time and task
management, problem-solving, and a reasonable amount of people skills.

**  
**

\--Do I need a college degree?--

You just need to be awesome.

**  
**

\--Are there any geographic restrictions?--

As long as you are in a country that doesnâ€™t have active sanctions from the US
government, we are interested. Our founder isnâ€™t known for respecting the
government much, but they have all the guns, soâ€¦

**  
**

\--Do I need an engineering degree?--

Nope. Our current product engineer is largely self-taught and didn't go to
engineering school. We don't care about credentials - we care about whether
you can actually invent great products. If you can demonstrate strong CAD
skills and a track record of making things, that matters way more than a
diploma.

**  
**

\--What CAD software do you use?--

We currently use SolidWorks, but we're not religious about it. What matters is
that you can produce production-ready 3D models. If you're proficient in
Fusion 360, AutoCAD, or similar - that's fine. Just know that you'll need to
come in with strong 3D modeling skills; we're not training from zero.

**  
**

\--How many products will I work on at once?--

Typically 1-2 at a time. This is deep focus work, not juggling a dozen things.
You'll spend months on a single product, iterating until it's genuinely great.

**  
**

\--What if I've never worked in consumer products before?--

That's fine, as long as you have demonstrated ability to design and prototype
physical products. Whether that came from industrial design, mechanical
engineering, or just being a maker who builds stuff in your garage - we care
about the skill, not the pedigree.

**  
**

\--Do I need to deal with manufacturers directly?--

You'll collaborate with our supply chain team on Design for Manufacturing and
be involved in sourcing decisions, but you won't own the vendor relationships.
Supply chain handles the day-to-day communication with factories. Your job is
to design products that can actually be manufactured.

**  
**

\--What does a typical day look like?--

Variable as hell. Some days you're deep in CAD. Some days you're running
prototype tests. Some days you're researching materials or competitor
products. Very few meetings. Basically no bureaucracy. What's consistent is
working independently, solving hard problems, and pushing toward "remarkable."

**  
**

\--6-36 months per product? Really?--

Really. We iterate until it's genuinely great. We'd rather take 2 years to
launch something remarkable than rush out something mediocre in 3 months. If
that timeline makes you anxious, this probably isn't the role for you.

**  
**

\--What types of products will I be working on?--

Primarily kitchen and household products. Things that solve real problems
people have. We're especially interested in products that can be patented and
are hard for competitors to copy. Generally, we want to either radically
improve a product in its category (like 200% better) or invent a new category.

**  
**

\--This sounds pretty good, though Iâ€™m still skeptical that this isnâ€™t a
pyramid scheme.--

You sound just like the tax authorities!

**  
**

\--That doesnâ€™t resolve any of my fears, but what do I need to do to apply?--

Please submit your information on the following page to apply. ****We promise
to respond within 5-10 business days even if our answer is No.

**  
**

There will be multiple steps in this process, FYI, including a long written
application, interviews with potentially a few different people, and paid work
test(s). Hiring the right people is really hard and very expensive if we do it
poorly, so we have to front-load the process. I'm sorry about that and thank
you for sticking with us.

**  
**

Once youâ€™re in our pipeline though, I would anticipate giving you a final
answer within a few weeks, depending on how it goes. We definitely donâ€™t want
to string you along, and as long as you do what we ask, we promise to tell you
â€œyesâ€ or â€œnoâ€, and to not just ghost you (like everybody I match with on
Tinder).

**  
**

Thank you for your time and interest, and I hope we can work together soon!

Please mention the word **EXCITEDLY** when applying to show you read the job
post completely (#RMjQwNzphYTgwOjEyNjpiZDkwOjFjMGM6YTkyZTpkMDBhOjJhNDM=). This
is a feature to avoid fake spam applicants. Companies can search these words
to find applicants that read this and instantly see they're human.  
  

## Salary and compensation

  
$50,000 â€” $120,000/year  
  

## Benefits

postTitle: Content Engineer, Developer Documentation at LiveKit
jobTitle: Content Engineer, Developer Documentation at LiveKit
descContent:
LiveKit is revolutionizing the AI landscape by providing the essential network
infrastructure that powers multimodal AI interfaces, enabling seamless audio
and visual interactions. Founded in 2021, LiveKit has rapidly grown to support
over 3 Billion calls annually, 200,000+ developers globally, and industry
giants like OpenAI, Salesforce, Spotify, and Meta.

**You'll Thrive at LiveKit if You:**

  * obsessed with making the best product for our customers.

  * are known as the go-to person for tackling tough problems

  * work hard and can build _and_ ship fast

  * focused on polish, detail and quality

  * are a fast learner, frequently picking up new tips, tricks, and skills

The best way to impress us is with thoughtful ways youâ€™d implement LiveKit,
and potentially tinkering with it ğŸ˜Š

About This Role:

LiveKit is building the modern, open platform for real-time audio and video.
Developers use our SDKs and APIs to add interactive video, voice, and live
media features into their apps. We're used in healthcare, fitness, virtual
events, customer support, gaming, and more â€” anywhere people collaborate or
connect live online.

Weâ€™re looking for a **Content Engineer** with a deep understanding of software
development who is passionate about helping developers succeed through great
documentation and learning resources. This is not just a technical writing
role â€” youâ€™ll be writing real code, testing SDKs, and directly improving our
documentation site alongside our engineering team.

What You'll Do:

    * **Author and maintain high-quality developer documentation** , including tutorials, SDK guides, and API references that serve both novice and advanced developers.

    * **Write and run code** â€” test LiveKitâ€™s SDKs and APIs (JavaScript, Swift, Kotlin, etc.) to create working examples and verify correctness of documentation.

    * **Extend our documentation infrastructure** , improving the site UX, build pipeline, search-ability, or layout to make the docs more useful and maintainable.

    * **Improve and maintain written content across our open source repos** , including READMEs, examples, and package documentation to ensure clarity and consistency.

    * **Collaborate closely with engineering and product** to understand new features and help launch them with strong supporting materials.

    * **Own content quality** by identifying and fixing inconsistencies, outdated references, or unclear explanations.

    * Help **shape the future** of our learning content by proposing new formats, interactive examples, or educational tools to better serve the LiveKit developer community.

You Might be a Good Fit if You:

      * Have **strong writing skills** and a knack for explaining complex technical topics clearly and concisely.

      * Are a **practicing developer** â€” comfortable working in multiple programming languages and familiar with web application development.

      * Have experience with or interest in **real-time communication, video streaming, or multimedia APIs**.

      * Have contributed to or maintained **technical documentation** , developer blogs, or tutorial content in a professional or open-source setting.

Bonus Points if You:

        * Have built or contributed to documentation tooling or developer portals.

        * Have a portfolio of writing samples, such as published tutorials, API guides, or technical blog posts.

**Our Commitments to You**

### **We offer**

          * An opportunity to build something truly impactful to the world

          * Contribute to open source alongside world-class engineers

          * Competitive salary and equity package

          * Health, dental, and vision benefits

          * Flexible vacation policy

Superside is looking for an AI Specialist to push the boundaries of whatâ€™s
possible when creativity meets technology. In this role, your main focus will
be helping our Sales team win new business through imaginative, high-impact
creative showcases that demonstrate whatâ€™s possible with Superside. Youâ€™ll
also work with the Marketing team to explore new ways AI can elevate our
campaigns, storytelling, and creative workflows.

  

Youâ€™ll sit within the Marketing team and partner closely with Sales, strategy,
and creative leaders across time zones. Youâ€™ll be the bridge between creative
craft and AI innovation, turning ideas into visual stories that inspire
customers and show the power of pairing AI with creative expertise.

Superside is looking for an AI Specialist to push the boundaries of whatâ€™s
possible when creativity meets technology. In this role, your main focus will
be helping our Sales team win new business through imaginative, high-impact
creative showcases that demonstrate whatâ€™s possible with Superside. Youâ€™ll
also work with the Marketing team to explore new ways AI can elevate our
campaigns, storytelling, and creative workflows.

  

Youâ€™ll sit within the Marketing team and partner closely with Sales, strategy,
and creative leaders across time zones. Youâ€™ll be the bridge between creative
craft and AI innovation, turning ideas into visual stories that inspire
customers and show the power of pairing AI with creative expertise.

### What You'll Do

* Partner with Sales to create quick-turn creative showcases, prototypes, and visual examples that bring Supersideâ€™s AI-enhanced capabilities to life.
* Join customer conversations to help translate creative ideas and AI potential into inspiring, practical solutions.
* Collaborate with Marketing to bring AI thinking into campaigns, social content, and storytelling that shows what creativity looks like in the age of AI.
* Explore and experiment with generative AI tools for image, video, and design to enhance speed, craft, and creativity.
* Develop and demonstrate repeatable AI workflows that help scale creative quality across teams.
* Translate technical possibilities into visual stories and creative outputs that feel strategic, useful, and human.
* Share learnings, trends, and best practices to help the broader Superside team stay ahead of the curve on AI-driven creativity.
* Advocate for thoughtful, ethical, and human-centred use of AI across all creative work.

### What You'll Need To Succeed

* 4+ years of experience in design, art direction, or creative leadership within a digital-first or agency environment.
* A strong portfolio that shows conceptual thinking, creative storytelling, and examples of AI-enhanced or technology-led work.
* Proven experience creating visual narratives that connect business value with creative impact.
* Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work across marketing, creative, and sales functions.
* Curiosity and confidence in experimenting with new AI tools and workflows.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to make complex ideas feel simple and exciting.
* A proactive mindset and passion for exploring how creativity and technology can work together.
* A grounded, collaborative approach that values curiosity, clarity, and craft in equal measure.

*Looking for some tips on how to improve your portfolio? We've got you covered!<https://careers.superside.com/building-a-standout-portfolio>

  

**Why Join us?**

  

Superside's vision is to create equal opportunities globally by accelerating
the worldâ€™s transition to online work. With that in mind, we're building a
fully remote company that attracts people where they are.

  

**Remote-first. Customer-led.**

Remote isnâ€™t just a perk; itâ€™s how we deliver better for customers. We are
fully committing to our customers by hiring top talent and collaborating
seamlessly across time zones.

**Global team, local impact.**

Join a community of 60+ nationalities working across time zones, cultures, and
disciplines, all aligned on doing great work for great brands.

**High performance, low ego.**

Work in a fast-paced, high-trust environment where feedback is direct, growth
is constant, and kindness leads collaboration.

**Impact meets opportunity.**

Weâ€™re in the sweet spot â€” big enough to be stable, small enough for you to
shape whatâ€™s next. Your ideas will matter here.

**Grow fast. Lead well.**

Youâ€™ll gain mentorship, take on real responsibility, and grow your career
while helping us disrupt a global industry.

  

**About Superside**

  

Superside is the leading AI-powered creative company that quickly and cost-
effectively enhances in-house functions. We help over 500 ambitious brands get
great creative concepts done at scale. Built to be an extension

of in-house teams, we unbottleneck marketing and creative teams so they can
move faster and drive more reliable creative performance.

Superside is a fully remote company with over 700 team members working across
60+ countries and 13 timezones.

  

Learn more at [superside.com](http://superside.com/)

  

**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**

  

Weâ€™re an equal-opportunity company. All applicants will be considered
regardless of ethnicity, appearance, religion, gender identity, sexual
orientation, national origin, veteran or disability status.

postTitle: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer, CRM at Circle
jobTitle: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer, CRM at Circle
descContent:
### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments â€” all in one place, all under
their own brand.

Weâ€™re proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, weâ€™ve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

### About the role

We're looking for a Senior Full-stack engineer to join our CRM/Workflow team
as we aim to make Circle the top choice for creator/brand-led communities.
You'll be working on features related to CRM, member sign-up/authentication,
workflow automations and helping our members connect with each other.

In this role, you will partake in all stages of the development lifecycle,
from initial task definition to final deployment. As a senior engineer, you'll
break down large epics into actionable tasks, follow through with development
and testing, review PRs, push updates to production, and gradually release
behind feature flags. Your responsibilities will also include bug-fixing and
continuous improvement of the codebase. This role requires a high level of
technical proficiency and a strong understanding of software development best
practices.

### What youâ€™ll be doing

  * Work autonomously on a product built in Ruby on Rails backend and React front-end.
  * Build critical features and improvements for our web app, with a product-first mindset.
  * Work closely with Circle's leaders throughout the feature design process.
  * Work closely with our designers to create a world-class user experience.
  * Foster a bias for action, prioritizing speed of iteration without compromising on the quality of code or user experience.

### What youâ€™ll need to be successful

  * Strong alignment with our values, [find our values on our career page](https://www.notion.so/Circle-Careers-223a15ea312c4922b793593d07add7fe?pvs=21) if you havenâ€™t read up on them yet.
  * 6+ years experience working as a full-stack engineer on complex web applications.
  * Strong proficiency in Ruby on Rails, MySQL/Postgresql, ReactJS, TypeScript, CSS/SCCS, TailwindCSS. 
    * Familiarity with both frontend and backend is necessary, but a high degree of proficiency in both is not a requirement. You should be able to individually build most small to medium features end-to-end across the stack, but you can excel in one over the other.
  * A desire to work in an environment which values speed of iteration and individual autonomy, while also embracing personal accountability and the ability to collaborate effectively as part of a dynamic team.
  * Motivation to understand the business, our users, their requirements, and to deliver results.
  * Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a certain level of ambiguity.
  * Great communication skills both in writing and verbal/oral (English).
  * Adaptable with the ability to change direction quickly if necessary.
  * Familiar with agile software development principles.
  * Should be able to lead a complex project end to end with judgment and an attention to detail when it comes to architectural, product, design, and process decisions, your judgment should inspire a high level of trust within the team.
  * Experience working on a fully distributed remote team.

### Bonus points

  * Experience with Elasticsearch / Sidekiq / Kafka / LLM APIs / Graph Databases / Data Science.
  * Previous experience working with community platforms.
  * Experience working on CRM, workflow automations solutions, recommendation systems or in the creator space.
  * Experience at a fast-growing start-up.
  * A track record of picking up new technologies and skills as you ship high-quality code.

### $130,000 - $140,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

  * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
  * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
  * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
  * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
  * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
  * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
  * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
  * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
  * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
  * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
Hereâ€™s how our CEO, Sid Yadav, frames our hiring mission: â€œletâ€™s find talent
in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.â€ To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on
the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by
applicable laws. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment
process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in
accordance with the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** in the EU
and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the
types of personal information we collect, the purpose for collecting it, and
your rights.

**Information We Collect:** We collect the following categories of personal
information from job applicants:

  * Contact information (such as name, email address, phone number)
  * Employment history and qualifications
  * Education history
  * References and any other information you choose to share with us during the application process

**Purpose of Collection:** We collect this information for the following
purposes:

  * To assess your qualifications and suitability for the position
  * To communicate with you during the recruitment process
  * To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

**Your Rights Under GDPR and CCPA:** You have the following rights regarding
your personal information:

  * The right to request access to the personal information we hold about you.
  * The right to request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain legal exceptions.
  * The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information (Note: We do not sell personal information).

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise
your rights, please refer to our full [Privacy
Policy](https://circle.so/privacy).

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and
understood this privacy notice.

# Mission

Commercial Real Estate (CRE) is the worldâ€™s largest asset class. Annual
transaction volume is 10% of GDP, yet the industry remains archaic because
data is locked in a black box of complexity. We are breaking that box open and
transforming CRE into an AI-native asset class.

# Traction

In just six months, we went from 0 code and 0 revenue to signing customers
with billions of AUM. Our product vision is clear, and we are delivering a
solution that truly solves CRE investorsâ€™ pain points.

# Hiring Positions

## Full-Stack Engineer

  * Own the infrastructure and UI that power high-value investment decisions.
  * Design scalable data pipelines and cloud architecture.
  * Tackle complex business logic with domain-driven design.
  * Experience with typescript / react / postgres / AWS

## UIUX/Design Engineer

  * Empathize with user experience
  * Provide critical input to guide product decision
  * Experience with Figma / StoryBook / Typescript / React

## Who are you:

You build things for fun, obsess over craft, and have a lot of product ideas.
You have proven experience shipping production software to solve ambiguous
business problems. You have experience with end-to-end NLP/IE and complex data
extraction.

[1.TK](http://1.TK) 2.TEMU 3.SHEIN 4.SHOPEE ç­‰å„å¤§è·¨å¢ƒå¹³å°çš„å®¡æ ¸ï¼Œç”³è¯·ï¼Œéœ€è¦æœ‰å¯¹åº”ç»éªŒçš„äººå¸®åŠ©æˆ‘è¿‡å®¡

**Job Summary**

We are seeking a Paid Media Specialist to manage, optimize, and scale paid
advertising campaigns across Google Ads and Meta (Facebook/Instagram)
platforms. This role plays a key part in driving conversions, leads, and
revenue through strategic and analytical performance marketing.

**Key Responsibilities**

  * Plan, launch, and manage paid advertising campaigns on Google Ads (Search, Display, YouTube, Performance Max) and Meta Ads (Facebook & Instagram)
  * Research target audiences, keywords, and competitors to improve campaign effectiveness
  * Continuously monitor, analyze, and optimize campaigns to achieve KPIs such as CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPC, and conversion rate
  * Develop and test ad creatives (copy, visuals, formats) in collaboration with content and design teams
  * Manage advertising budgets efficiently to maximize ROI
  * Set up and maintain tracking systems using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, and conversion tracking
  * Prepare weekly and monthly performance reports with insights and optimization recommendations
  * Stay updated with the latest digital advertising trends, platform updates, and best practices
  * Work closely with internal teams to align paid media strategies with overall marketing goals

**Requirements**

  * Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (preferred)
  * 1â€“3+ years of experience in Paid Media / Digital Advertising
  * Hands-on experience with Google Ads and Facebook/Instagram Ads
  * Strong analytical skills and data-driven mindset
  * Familiar with tracking, reporting, and performance measurement tools
  * Ability to manage multiple campaigns and meet deadlines
  * Good communication and teamwork skills

**Nice to Have**

  * Experience in lead generation or e-commerce campaigns
  * Knowledge of A/B testing, remarketing, and funnel optimization
  * Experience managing medium to large advertising budgets
  * Google Ads or Meta Blueprint certifications

**Benefits**

  * Competitive salary with performance-based incentives
  * Opportunity to work with diverse clients and industries
  * Fast-growing digital advertising environment
  * Career development and learning opportunities

**How to Apply**

Please send your **CV** to: **hr****@dolphindigitalmarketing.com**  
**Subject:** Paid Media Specialist â€“ Full Name

postTitle: AI / ML Engineer, Senior UX/UI Designer
jobTitle: AI / ML Engineer, Senior UX/UI Designer
descContent:
Root Sustainability | AI / ML Engineer, Senior UX/UI Designer | REMOTE / The Netherlands (or hybrid) | Full-time | Seed-stage + equity

Weâ€™re Root Sustainability. We help companies understand the environmental
footprint of what they produce, starting from messy, incomplete operational
data. Think tens of millions of purchase order lines, vague product
descriptions, complex supply chains, messy ERP exports, and sustainability
logic that does not fit neatly into spreadsheets. Our goal is to turn all of
that into auditable, high-granularity insights that feel clear and usable.

Weâ€™ve recently closed a EUR 1M seed round and are growing the team across both
product design and AI. We are building foundational systems, not wrappers, and
we are looking for people who want to own real problems end to end.

Roles:

AI / ML Engineer

You will take the lead on everything AI inside the product. This is a hands-on
role: designing, building, evaluating, and deploying LLM-powered features end
to end. You will work closely with our engineering team, but you will own the
AI direction from prototype to production.

Senior UX/UI Designer

You will own UX/UI end to end: research, flows, wireframes, prototypes, and
polished interfaces that make complex sustainability domains feel obvious. You
work closely with product and engineering as a partner, shaping what we build
next.

What you will do (AI / ML):

Design domain-specific inference pipelines for environmental data.

Make LLM outputs stable, traceable, and reproducible.

Build structured reasoning systems, not just chat.

Use embeddings and semantic similarity to match product descriptions to impact
datasets.

Evaluate models for accuracy, hallucinations, and bias.

Deploy and operate LLM workloads on AWS.

Integrate AI outputs into a Python and Postgres platform.

What you will do (UX/UI):

Lead design for key features: mapping, dashboards, workflows.

Turn fuzzy sustainability problems into clear, user-centered interfaces.

Build prototypes and run lightweight user testing.

Maintain and evolve a design system in Figma.

Ship frequently with engineers, not just hand off specs.

You should apply if (AI / ML):

You have 3 to 5+ years experience in software and or ML engineering.

You are strong in Python with hands-on LLM or NLP experience.

You have deployed AI systems in production on AWS or similar.

You think in systems and pipelines, not just prompts.

You care about evaluation, monitoring, and reproducibility.

You have a product mindset and optimize for clarity and user value.

You should apply if (UX/UI):

You have around 5+ years experience in UX/UI with a strong portfolio.

You are pragmatic: clarity over trends, iteration over perfection.

You thrive in early-stage environments with shifting priorities.

You know design systems, user research, and can defend decisions.

Bonus: data visualization experience, sustainability interest, accessibility
skills.

Constraints:

Authorized to work in the EU or able to work as a contractor.

Availability overlaps with 10:00 to 16:00 CET.

Perks:

Competitive salary with stock options.

Remote-friendly or hybrid with occasional meetups.

Unlimited vacation days.

Direct impact on product direction and core systems.

Small, kind, motivated team solving hard problems together.

How to apply:

AI / ML Engineer: <https://root-sustainability.homerun.co/ai-ml-engineer>

Senior UX/UI Designer: <https://root-sustainability.homerun.co/senior-ux-ui-
designer>

# **About Dex**

[https://dex.camera](https://dex.camera?utm_source=chatgpt.com)

Dex is a startup focused on **AI Ã— childrenâ€™s language learning**. We build
**Dex Camera** , an AI-powered learning camera designed for global markets â€”
turning the real world into language-learning material. Kids learn naturally
through **taking photos, exploring, and storytelling** in real-life contexts,
instead of passively consuming content on screens.

Dex Camera is already live in international markets, with a **4.8 / 5 user
rating** , and has received multiple recognitions including the **CES
Innovation Awards 2026**.

Weâ€™re a small, high-impact team, and every person matters. Each team member
participates in shaping the product and is accountable for their decisions and
outcomes.

# **Role 1: Senior Web Developer**

**Focus:** Marketing Site + Content Tools

**Location:** Shenzhen (Hybrid)

**Type:** Full-time

## **What youâ€™ll do**

You will own two major areas (both critical):

### **1) Marketing Site**

  * Build and continuously optimize the company website, landing pages, campaign pages, brand pages, and purchase-related pages 
  * Focus on performance, SEO, accessibility, and conversion â€” not just visual polish 
  * Work closely with marketing and design to ship fast, validate quickly, and iterate continuously

### **2) Content / Productivity Tools**

  * Build internal tools for content and operations teams to improve content creation and publishing efficiency 
  * Use **Web technologies + Python** to build content tools, automation workflows, and lightweight services 
  * Leverage **AI capabilities** (content generation, data processing, automation, etc.) to continuously improve team productivity and workflows

You will be involved in technical decisions and solution design â€” not just
executing line-by-line requirements.

## **What weâ€™re looking for**

  * Senior-level web engineer (5+ years of experience, or clearly equivalent capability) 
  * Strong web fundamentals and familiarity with modern stacks (React / Next.js / Astro / Vue â€” stack is flexible) 
  * Solid **Python** experience â€” able to independently build scripts, tools, or simple services 
  * Strong engineering judgment around code quality, performance, and maintainability; able to push better engineering practices 
  * **Basic spoken English** for day-to-day work communication 
  * High ownership: able to drive progress and deliver results even when requirements are incomplete 
  * Comfortable using **AI tools** to boost productivity (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude Code, Cursor, etc.)

## **Nice to have**

  * Experience in Marketing / Growth / CMS / Content Platform 
  * Hands-on experience systematically improving content or engineering workflows with AI 
  * Experience building for international users or global products

## **What we offer**

  * Hybrid working model, outcome-driven, no clock-in culture 
  * Small team, high ownership â€” your work directly impacts the product and the business 
  * An engineering culture that encourages AI + automation for real productivity gains 
  * Competitive compensation and strong growth opportunities

* * *

# **Role 2: Content Operations**

**Focus:** Childrenâ€™s content Ã— Aesthetic/art background Ã— AI content
generation  
**Location:** Shenzhen (Hybrid)  
**Type:** Full-time

## **What this role is about**

This is a cross-functional role at the intersection of **content + product +
AI**.  
You wonâ€™t just â€œproduce contentâ€â€” you will help define what kids **see, hear,
and learn** inside Dex, and build a content system that can scale and evolve.

Your work will center around three areas:

### **1) Childrenâ€™s Content Planning & Production**

  * Produce content for childrenâ€™s language learning (interactive prompts, stories/tasks, contextual expressions, etc.) 
  * Turn learning goals into content experiences that kids can understand and actually want to engage with 
  * Collaborate with product, design, and AI teams to refine content presentation and pacing

### **2) AI Content Generation & Optimization (Core Skill)**

  * Deeply use AI tools to generate **multimedia content** , primarily **images and audio**
  * Design and maintain prompts, rules, and workflows to make outputs more stable and aligned with childrenâ€™s expression and the brand tone 
  * Continuously evaluate and iterate content quality â€” making AI outputs feel more like they come from â€œa creator who truly understands kidsâ€ 
  * Edit and refine AI-generated outputs using tools like **Photoshop or other creative software** when needed

### **3) Content Operations & Quality Control**

  * Own content quality, style consistency, and child-appropriateness (readability, engagement, guidance style, etc.) 
  * Build scalable production and management processes â€” not just a one-time content dump

## **What weâ€™re looking for**

  * Background in **childrenâ€™s content / illustration / art / design / education** (any one or a combination) 
  * A solid understanding of how children express themselves, how they learn, and what appeals to them (what attracts them, where they get stuck) 
  * Strong AI content generation capability: familiar with and willing to deeply use AI tools to improve efficiency and quality 
  * Proficiency with **Photoshop or similar tools** for editing and cleanup 
  * Strong sense of ownership: willing to take long-term responsibility for content outcomes, not just completing tasks 
  * **Basic English** for reading and simple communication 
  * Strong collaborator: able to work with product/design/engineering so content becomes part of the product experience 
  * Experience with Prompt Engineering or AI workflow design (reusable, iterative systems)

## **Nice to have**

  * Experience with picture books, interactive content, childrenâ€™s education products, toys/games 
  * Experience with multilingual / international childrenâ€™s content 
  * Experience building content standards, content QA, or content workflow systems

## **Why this role matters**

  * What you create directly shapes how children learn and experience the product 
  * Youâ€™re not â€œfilling a content libraryâ€ â€” youâ€™re shaping the product itself 
  * Youâ€™ll help define early rules and standards for the AI content system, not just maintain it later

## **What we offer**

  * Hybrid working model, outcome-driven 
  * Deep collaboration with product, AI, and engineering 
  * A team culture that values taste and judgment, and encourages fast experimentation and iteration 
  * Competitive compensation and strong growth opportunities

* * *

# **Role 3: Operations & Customer Experience Manager**

**Focus:** **Location:** Shenzhen (Hybrid)  
**Type:** Full-time

## **What this role is about**

Weâ€™re looking for a full-time **Operations & Customer Experience Manager** to
help run the core of the company.

This role sits at the **center of the Dex product experience** â€” where
customers, operations, and the product all meet. Youâ€™ll contribute from day
one by owning customer conversations, improving how we support families, and
building the processes that allow the company to scale.

This is a hands-on, ownership-driven role. Youâ€™ll take real responsibility,
solve real problems, and help shape how an AI startup operates behind the
scenes. For the right person, this role offers significant growth and long-
term opportunity.

### **What Youâ€™ll Own**

  * Own customer conversations end to end, responding to parents with empathy, clarity, and confidence 

  * Actively refine and improve customer response macros over time based on real customer interactions 

  * Use **Zendesk** to manage tickets, categorize issues, and maintain clean workflows 

  * Use **Shopify** to investigate orders, shipments, and customer history when resolving issues

  * Own operational workflows related to returns, exchanges, lost packages, and chargebacks (weâ€™ll teach you Dexâ€™s specific policies) 

  * Design and document repeatable processes so customer and operations issues are handled consistently 

  * Track recurring issues and surface patterns, risks, and insights to leadership 

  * Take ownership of cross-functional projects across logistics, content launches, and international operations, working closely with the core team

###

### **What Weâ€™re Looking For**

  * Prior experience working directly with customers or a user community (customer support, CX, community management, operations, or similar) 
  * Comfortable owning customer conversations and making judgment calls in real time 
  * Experience using **Zendesk** (or a similar helpdesk tool) 
  * Experience using **Shopify** (or a similar e-commerce platform) 
  * Strong written communication skills with a warm, calm, and confident tone 
  * Organized, systems-oriented, and motivated to improve how things work 
  * Strong interest in startups and early-stage environments 
  * Excellent English written and verbal communication skills

Role:  
We're hiring a Senior Marketing Manager - Paid Ads.  
Highly Competitive Salary:

\- $100k-$500k USD yearly.  
\- Equity and large upside based on performance is available and negotiable.
Based on ROAS and perceived future leverage.

What You'll Do:

\- Own the full funnel (TOF/MOF/BOF) across all paid ads platforms  
\- Find the arbitrage opportunities - Such as Rumble ads, the push/pop
networks, the weird corners of the internet where CPMs are still cheap  
\- Turn "we don't have a creative" into "we have 47 variations in testing"  
\- Plan and outline video and static creative that makes people stop scrolling
and start clicking  
\- Manage a team of editors who will execute your unhinged creative visions  
\- Make numbers go up

Candidate Requirements:

\- 8+ hours daily in ad dashboards and scrolling to finds creatives (you check
Meta Ads Manager before your texts)

Preferred Skillsets:

\- Lucky  
\- Has lost at least $10k of someone else's money learning what doesn't work  
\- Can explain the difference between broad and lookalike targeting to a child
or a CEO  
\- Meta, TikTok, Google SEM/DV360, Snapchat, Pinterest - you've bled budget on
all of them  
\- Knows what push/pop ads are and isn't scared  
\- Has opinions about landing page load times  
\- Can spot a winning hook in the first 0.3 seconds  
\- Comfortable with platforms that don't have "established best practices" yet  
\- Experience scaling something from $0 to "we need to talk about our credit
limit"  
\- If you've ever made a UGC-style ad that outperformed a $50k production,
mention it  
\- Willing to test on platforms your friends have never heard of

Location:

Remote - Anywhere in US/EU/Others feel free to apply  
Banned locations: Agencies

If you're unsure whether you're qualified, that's a good sign, apply.  
zach@acebet.com or @zachsidwell on TG

Please mention the word **BLOSSOM** when applying to show you read the job
post completely (#RNDcuMTEuNDIuMTE4). This is a feature to avoid fake spam
applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this
and instantly see they're human.

$200,000 â€” $500,000/year
