jobTitle: Sales Development Representative at Chili Piper
descContent:
### **About Chili Piper**

Chili Piper is a B2B SaaS startup. Our product helps clients turn inbound
leads into qualified meetings instantly, helping revenue teams connect to
buyers faster. We are a fully remote global team dedicated to solving
interesting problems, helping others, and having fun.

Weâ€™re growing fast and we're ready to take over the world (in the most civil
and appropriate way possible, of course).

### Job Description

As a Sales Development Representative at Chili Piper, you will drive Chili
Piper's future growth engine by working with the Account Executive team to
build pipeline. You are excited about prospecting to potential customers, and
are capable of identifying high potential Customers for Chili Piper. You are
adept at identifying high value opportunities and capable of managing early
sales funnel activities. You are used to delivering value in competitive
situations and enjoy working on products that drive the future of Sales.
Finally, you enjoy building â€“ you like to actively participate in the
development of the sales process and have fun building out our Sales team.

We take a data driven, analytical approach to outbound sales, and are looking
for someone who is confident in both prospecting to customers and in helping
design our strategy. If youâ€™re hungry, smart, persistent, and a great
teammate, we want to hear from you!

_**What You'll Do**_

  * Identify high-potential businesses and develop and execute outbound strategies to bring them to Chili Piper

  * Develop and lead outbound campaigns from idea-generation through to qualified meetings

  * Launch and test new outbound lead generation channels and determine how best to scale them

  * Work with cross-functional teams and build the roots of our Sales team

  * Hit the phones confidently with prospects from self-sourced and SDR generated efforts

  * Launch and test new outbound lead generation channels and determine how best to scale them

  * 1:1â€™s with your manager, meet & shadow current members of the Chili Piper team

  * Set monthly OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) with your manager and develop an action plan to achieve them

  * Become a product expert

  * Consistently achieve your activity goals

### Qualifications

 _**What We're Looking For**_

  * 1+ years of sales experience, preferably at a technology company, with a track record of top performance

  * Strong analytical and quantitative capabilities

  * Superior verbal and written communication skills

  * Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment

  * Self starter who is used to working in a scrappy team

  * Strong interest in technology

  * Active and engaged LinkedIn presence

 _**Additional Skills**_

  * Passion for Chili Piper values of Help & Compassion, Innovate, Take Ownership, Growth Mindset, Have Fun

  * Thrive in a fast pace environment with ability to prioritize and multi-task on the fly

  * Strong emotional intelligence skills

  * Resourcefulness, creativity and strategic thinking for troubleshooting problems

  * Self motivated and self-directed; Fast learner

  * Strong English communication and documentation skills

  * Ability to work in a dynamic environment in which the requirements are not always well defined and priorities change frequently

  * Strong attention to detail and documentation

  * Comfortable in supporting and working with global customers across many time zones

### **Additional Information**

**Why you'll love being a part of our team:**

Our team loves Chili Piper because [weâ€™re building the company of the future.
](https://www.chilipiper.com/post/company-of-the-future)

  * Work with an immensely talented global team

  * Work in a business thatâ€™s run fairly and transparently

  * Competitive pay based on market rate wherever you live

  * We lead by example--showing industry peers and leaders how to innovate, improve, and grow--while having fun

**How we work:**

  * **Freedom and flexibility.** Weâ€™re a 100% distributed team working from around the world, and we've been fully remote since 2016.  _**Our team members can work from wherever they want**_ in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.

  * **Solve interesting problems.** The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.

  * **Autonomy and ownership.** Working on a distributed team means you donâ€™t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youâ€™re getting things done. Weâ€™re a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.

  * **Be helpful.** Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

**The perks:**

  * Unlimited vacation (and we _do_ mean it, and we _do_ take it!)

  * Generous health, dental, and vision insurance

  * Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job

  * Annual professional development stipend of $2,000 USD

  * Equity - all Pipers receive stock options

  * Annual company retreat for a week of bonding and adventure (previous retreat locations include Paris, Morocco, Tulum, Iceland, Ibiza, and India!)

Join the VRChat Team!

  

VRChat offers a first-of-its-kind, game-changing platform that provides an
endless collection of social VR experiences and gives the power of creation to
its robust community. With over 250,000 worlds and growing, VRChatâ€™s vision is
to allow users to bring their imaginations to life and help shape the
metaverse anywhere in the world on any device. VRChat has raised $100M to date
with the support of investors, Makers Fund, Anthos Capital and HTC.

  

We have a great team which includes people from: Netflix, Twitter, Meta,
Microsoft, Roblox, Google, Amazon, Unity, Spotify, Discord, Uber, eBay,
Robinhood, Twitch, Zynga and TikTok. Come and join the mission!

  

Job Overview

  

We are looking for a DevOps Leader with security experience to lead our
passionate DevOps team ensuring the smooth operation and security of the
VRChat infrastructure. In this role youâ€™ll be accountable for the uptime,
security, proper operation and cost effectiveness of our infrastructure
supporting millions of active users and petabytes of UGC content.

  

Help us run and secure our platform that allows our users to connect and
create their part of the VRChat universe. If youâ€™re interested in keeping the
machinery behind the scenes humming and finely tuned, then this role could be
right up your alley.

  

The role reports to the VP of Engineering at VRChat. This Engineering leader
will work closely with the IT and Development teams, as well as the heads of
various functions to plan and deploy infrastructure.

### Duties & Responsibilities

* Lead a small, thriving team of DevOps Engineers
* Foster direct communication with several other closely-related teams such as IT, Server Engineers, Client Security, User Support, and Community Team
* Design, plan and implementation of IT infrastructure in a hybrid cloud environment to support the evolution of our platform
* Hands-on day to day operation and maintenance of our infrastructure to keep our services running with high reliability, security and cost effectiveness
* Incident management and root cause analysis, sometimes during off hours
* Ensure the implementation and maintenance of robust security controls and practices
* Automate and improve our monitoring systems and tools
* Coordination and communication within the team and with internal stakeholders
* Work with external vendors to resolve issues and coordinate projects
,

### Experience, Skills & Qualifications

* Proven experience (8+ years) in a DevOps leadership role, within a high-growth consumer-facing company, preferably in a fast-paced startup environment
* Experience with hybrid cloud environments and infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform, Terragrunt, OpenTofu, and octoDNS
* Experience with highly reliable networking and tools such as Wireguard and Tailscale
* Experience designing, building and maintaining high available and reliable network infrastructure
* Experience maintaining DDoS protection and intrusion detection and prevention systems from different vendors, such as Cloudflare and AWS CloudFront/AWS Shield/AWS WAF
* Experience with content delivery networks (CDNs)
* Knowledge of setup, configuration and operation of clustered data stores such as MongoDB, Redis/Valkey and MySQL
* Experience participating in proactive system hardening, engaging in technical security audits, and threat-hunting across multiple interconnected systems
* Experience in rapidly responding to and mitigating operational & security incidents, including coordinating with internal security, legal, and public relations teams
* Strong knowledge of REST web applications, API endpoint security and scripting knowledge, including Golang and Node.js
* Experience with realtime multiplayer game engines, Photon or other real-time networking, MMORPG or C# application security is desirable
* Familiarity with common Cybersecurity and Information Technology frameworks and standards such as MITRE ATT&CK, COBIT, and ITIL
* Knowledge of ISO27001/27002, SOC2, IG2 certifications and standards
* Preferably expertise in building security infrastructure that conforms to FTC guidance and international privacy laws such as the GDPR
* Exceptional communication skills with the ability to articulate and evangelize concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
,

### Benefits

* Work from anywhere! VRChat is a 100% remote company
* Health Benefits
* 401K for US & RRSP for Canadian Employees
* Stock Options
* Generous paid holiday schedule
* Unlimited/Flexible vacation time
* Paid parental leave benefits

VRChat is an equal-opportunity employer, and we welcome applicants from all
backgrounds. VRChat fosters a diverse, creative, and collaborative environment
where anyone can contribute to any of the ongoing projects or direction of the
roadmap at any time. If youâ€™re a passionate team player who wants to have an
impact on a dynamic team, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

  

All job offers are subject to satisfactory referencing and background checks.

**Who We Are**

Hi, we're DuckDuckGo, the online protection company and remote-first team of
300+ on a mission to raise the standard of trust online. Founded in 2008 and
profitable since 2014, annual revenue now exceeds $100m USD and millions use
our browser on [Mac](https://spreadprivacy.com/introducing-duckduckgo-for-
mac/), [Windows](https://spreadprivacy.com/windows-browser-open-beta/),
[iOS](https://spreadprivacy.com/duckduckgo-privacy-browser-ios14/), and
[Android](https://spreadprivacy.com/introducing-app-tracking-protection/), our
[search engine](https://duckduckgo.com/), and the latest â€” [Privacy
Pro](https://spreadprivacy.com/meetprivacypro/). Our
[culture](https://duckduckgo.com/how-we-work) of trust, inclusivity, and
empowered project management underpins everything we do, where each team
member takes full ownership of their projects, from scoping and execution to
postmortem. If you're seeking end-to-end ownership of your work â€” you've come
to the right place!

**Your Team and Role**

While you'll be based on the Marketing Communications Functional Team, in this
role, you will work across the marketing, product, content, engineering, and
design teams to ensure every experience a user has with our brand is
consistent and feels like DuckDuckGo. You'll help us understand what makes our
tens of millions of users unique by developing in-depth insights about our
user segments, their needs and motivations, and translating those insights
into our user-facing touchpoints such as ads and product pages. Recent
projects include:

  1. Coordinating cross-team work related to visual identity evolution, both in and out of the product.

  2. Execute innovative social campaign activations to drive word-of-mouth growth.

While we encourage everyone at DuckDuckGo to be a steward of the brand, as a
**Brand Strategist** , you'll be a go-to resource to help make sure it's being
executed on effectively.

**About You**

  1. 7+ years of experience in brand positioning and strategy work. This role is not in charge of ad creative development, though contributes to those projects.

  2. You demonstrate a strong sense of ownership. Experience executing on high-impact and complex projects from proposal through post-mortem. No task is too small.

  3. Skills to wrangle vague problems and propose innovative and pragmatic solutions.

  4. Strong attention to detail. You catch the small things others miss.

  5. Demonstrated experience and proficiency in leveraging qualitative and quantitative data to guide creative decisions. 

  6. You're a persuasive writer with experience crafting brand guidelines and messaging frameworks.

**Compensation**

**$178,500** **USD annually** and stock options. Compensation is [identical
within professional levels](https://duckduckgo.com/how-we-work), regardless of
geographic location or team. Compensation for each professional level is
transparent across the organization.

Eligibility for company-sponsored health benefits is limited to team members
based in the United States. This program does not extend to team members
located in other countries, such as Canada or the UK.

Our[ Team Member Support
Guide](https://duckduckgo.com/assets/hiring/team_support_guide.pdf) explains
how we prioritize your wellbeing including **paid parental leave, office
setup,** and **co-working allowances.**

**Hiring Process**

Hiring works best when it's a two-way street. Learn how we help you get to
know DuckDuckGo, envision your future role here, and find out more about [how
we hire](https://duckduckgo.com/how-we-hire).

**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**

DuckDuckGo provides equal work opportunities to all team members and
applicants, and it prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type on the
basis of race, color, ethnicity, caste, religion, age, sex (including
pregnancy), national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran
status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other
characteristic protected by our policies or federal, state, or local laws.

We want to ensure that our hiring process is accessible. If you need
reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process because of a
medical condition or disability, please send an email to
[careers@duckduckgo.com](mailto:careers@duckduckgo.com) to let us know the
nature of your request.

**Please note that:**

    1. Youâ€™ll be required to attend meetings on camera via video conferencing

    2. Expect to travel at least two times a year: once for our all-hands meetup and again for a team retreat (each around 4-5 days). While extenuating circumstances may impact attendance, everyone is strongly encouraged to attend.

    3. While we offer a flexible work arrangement with no core hours, expect an average full-time commitment of 40 hours per week.

    4. A successful candidate must pass a background check as a condition of joining the team.

    5. By applying for this role, you confirm that all information submitted is accurate and complete. You further acknowledge that providing false or fraudulent information during the application process is cause for denial of an offer, revocation of any existing offer, or other adverse action, up to and including termination after the start of your commencement of work.

**Disclosure Statement: Use of AI in Hiring Process**

As part of our commitment to enhancing our recruitment process, we utilize
artificial intelligence (AI) technology to assist in reviewing and summarizing
job applications and test projects, including those tools integrated into our
recruitment vendor platforms. We use AI to flag potentially fraudulent
applications, analyze and summarize applicantsâ€™ experience, interviews, and
project performance, and help streamline our selection process.

**Key Principles:**

      1. **Data Privacy:** All information provided in your application will be handled in accordance with our [Recruiting Privacy Policy](https://duckduckgo.com/static-assets/files/pages/careers/DuckDuckGo-Recruiting-Privacy-Policy-effective-September-30-2025.pdf). We ensure that your personal information is protected and used solely for recruitment purposes.

      2. **Human Oversight and Accountability:** The AI technology is designed to support our hiring team by providing insights and summaries of applications and evaluations of test projects against scoring rubrics. All final evaluations and hiring decisions, however, will be made by our hiring team, who will consider the AI's input alongside other factors.

      3. **Transparency:** We believe in transparency regarding our hiring practices. If you have any questions about how AI is used in our recruitment process, please feel free to reach out to us.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge and consent to the use of AI
technology in our review process. If you would like to request an alternative
selection process, please contact us as at
[careers@duckduckgo.com](mailto:careers@duckduckgo.com). Thank you for your
interest in joining DuckDuckGo!

descContent:
Senior Front-end Engineer  
  
Responsibilities:  
1\. Responsible for the development of the WEB version of the company's
blockchain financial products, able to independently analyze and design
according to requirements, and complete the corresponding code writing.  
2\. Able to formulate standardized interfaces, and utilize backend APIs to
present various types of data and control functionalities.  
3\. Assist in the maintenance and upgrade of released products, continuously
improving user experience.  
4\. Participate in the implementation of high-quality, user-friendly WEB
frontend applications for company projects.  
5\. Continuously optimize frontend experience and page response speed,
ensuring system compatibility and execution efficiency, possessing a certain
sense of design aesthetics, and maintaining good user experience.  
Requirements:  
1\. 211/985 Bachelor's degree or above in computer-related major, with 5 years
or more experience in front-end development.  
2\. Solid programming skills, good design ability, and programming habits,
proficient in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5.  
3\. Familiar with the principles of frontend popular frameworks such as React
and Vue, and have practical experience in related project development.  
4\. Prior experience in financial products such as stocks, cryptocurrencies
etc., is preferred.  
5\. Strong sense of responsibility and teamwork, good learning ability,
logical thinking ability, dare to innovate and accept challenges, able to work
under certain pressure.

**Location:** Remote (or Hybrid, depending on timezone)  
**Employment Type:** Full-time (or Contract if required)  
**Salary:** Competitive, based on experience

### About the Role

As a Full Stack Developer, youâ€™ll work across the application, contributing to
both front-end and back-end development. Youâ€™ll collaborate closely with a
small team, take ownership of features, and help us build something scalable,
secure, and user-friendly.

Key responsibilities include:

  * Building and maintaining core features across the full stack

  * Working with product and design to turn ideas into production-ready features

  * Developing APIs and integrating third-party services

  * Writing clean, maintainable, and well-tested code

  * Helping make technical decisions that support future growth

  * Supporting deployment, monitoring, and performance improvements

### Tech Stack

Weâ€™re open to different technologies and expect the stack to evolve.
Experience with the following is required:

  * React (JavaScript)

  * .NET (C#)

  * Flutter (Dart)

  * PostgreSQL

  * MongoDB

### What Weâ€™re Looking For

  * 2â€“5 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role

  * Comfortable working across both front-end and back-end codebases

  * Experience building production web applications

  * Ability to work independently in a small team

  * Strong communication skills, especially in a remote environment

  * Interest in mission-driven or impact-focused products

### Nice to Have

  * Startup or early-stage product experience

  * Experience building scalable or high-traffic applications

  * Familiarity with security, authentication, or data privacy best practices

  * Interest in consumer platforms, reviews, or feedback systems

### What We Offer

  * Remote-first working environment

  * Small, collaborative team with real ownership and impact

  * Opportunity to shape a product from early stages

  * Flexible working hours

  * Competitive salary with growth opportunities

### How to Apply

Send us your CV and a short note about your experience and what excites you
about working on early-stage, mission-driven products.

postTitle: Cold Email Outreach Expert & Deliverability Engineer
jobTitle: Cold Email Outreach Expert & Deliverability Engineer
descContent:
We are looking for a rare hybrid: A data-driven **Deliverability Engineer**
who understands the "dark arts" of DNS and server reputation, combined with a
**Psychology-driven Copywriter** who knows how to break through a CEO's inbox.

You won't just be sending emails; you will be responsible for the entire
infrastructure, from domain procurement to lead sourcing and conversion
optimization.

**Your Responsibilities:**

  * **Infrastructure Management:** Setting up and maintaining multiple secondary domains, ensuring perfect SPF, DKIM, and DMARC alignment.

  * **Deliverability Monitoring:** Proactive monitoring of domain health via Google Postmaster Tools and specialized deliverability suites.

  * **Campaign Strategy:** Building scalable personalization workflows (using tools like Clay, Instantly, or Smartlead).

  * **List Hygiene:** Sourcing high-quality leads and implementing multi-step verification to keep bounce rates below 2%.

  * **Copywriting:** Writing and A/B testing high-intent, interest-based cold email sequences.

**Required Skills:**

  * Proven track record in managing high-volume cold outreach (1,000+ emails/day) without landing in spam.

  * Expert knowledge of DNS records (A, CNAME, MX, TXT) and SPF flattening.

  * Experience with Inbox Rotation and Custom Tracking Domains.

  * Ability to write "human-centric" copy that doesn't look like a template.

  * Experience with tools like Apollo, Clay, Smartlead/Instantly, and NeverBounce.

**How to Apply (Strict Instructions):** We do not accept standard CV-only
applications. To be considered, you **must** complete our technical vetting
form here:

[APPLICATION FORM](https://form.jotform.com/260112635057348)

* * *

Root Sustainability | Senior UX/UI Designer | REMOTE/The Netherlands (or hybrid) | Full-time | Seed-stage + equity

Weâ€™re Root Sustainability, helping retail brands to turn scattered, incomplete
operational data into auditable, high-granularity sustainability insights, and
weâ€™re doing it from the bottom up. Think tens of millions of data points,
messy ERP exports, complex supply chains, and sustainability logic that most
tools canâ€™t handle. Our goal is to make all of that feel simple, clear, and
usable for the people who rely on it every day.

Role:

Youâ€™ll own UX/UI end-to-end: research, flows, wireframes, prototypes, and
polished interfaces that make complicated domains feel obvious. You care about
usability, accessibility, and simplicity in the face of ambiguity. You work
closely with product and engineering, not as a service, but as a partner
shaping what we build next.

What youâ€™ll do:

Lead design for key features: mapping, dashboards, workflows.

Turn fuzzy sustainability domain problems into clear, user-centered
interfaces.

Build prototypes and run lightweight user testing to validate assumptions.

Maintain and evolve a design system (Figma, etc.).

Collaborate closely with engineers, youâ€™ll be shipping frequently, not just
handing off specs.

You should apply if:

You have ~5+ yrs experience in UX/UI with a strong portfolio.

Youâ€™re pragmatic: prioritize clarity over trends, iteration over perfection.

You thrive in early-stage environments where priorities shift quickly.

You know design systems, user research, and can defend your decisions.

Bonus: data viz experience, sustainability passion, accessibility chops.

Perks:

â‚¬60,000 â€“ â‚¬70,000 gross per year with stock options.

Remote-friendly / hybrid with occasional meetups.

Direct impact, your work shapes product direction.

Flat culture; work with a small, mission-driven team.

How to apply:

[https://root-sustainability.homerun.co/senior-ux-ui-
designer...](https://root-sustainability.homerun.co/senior-ux-ui-designer/en)

### **The Role:**

We are looking for a Senior Flutter Developer for one of our clients. You are
a perfect candidate if you are growth-oriented, you love what you do, and you
enjoy working on new ideas to develop exciting products and growth features.

****

#### What we are looking for:

  * 3 years of concentrated experience in Flutter 

  * 5+ years of experience in software development with a robust background in any framework/language/OS such as React Native, iOS (Swift), Android (Kotlin)

  * Proven track record of deploying applications on Google Play/App Store using Flutter.

  * Profound knowledge of front-end languages like HTML, CSS3, and JavaScript.

  * Comprehensive understanding of Object-Oriented programming languages like Java and C++.

  * Experience with version control tools (Git, Subversion, etc.) and IDEs (Android Studio, VS Code, etc.).

  * A commitment to following best practices and conventions in software development.

  * Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

  * Intermediate-advanced English level, with excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical clients.

  * Located in CET timezone (+/- 3 hours), we are unable to consider applications from candidates in other time zones.

#### Responsibilities:

  * You will be sharing feedback and brainstorming ideas with teams to improve the development process.

  * You will put effort in staying up-to-date with the latest technologies.

****

## Help expand our Reddit presence in the growing AI and virtual companion
space.

  * Pay: $800â€“$1200 per month
  * Work: Home-based, 40 hours per week

**Main task**

Make DRT FM a solid presence wherever virtual companions are mentioned. Same
as Candy.ai, Muah.ai are mentioned, DRT must be one of them.

Measure and track results, be able to display the effectiveness of your
efforts.

## **Required skills**

  * Good writing skills, understanding of specific subreddits to be insider (ideally already involved in AI communities)
  * Good at tracking/measuring/reporting results of your daily campaigns
  * You must have proven experience how to have a Reddit account(-s) that gets results and doesnt get banned
  * You should have direct, hands-on experience using anti-detect browsers like AdsPower and residential or mobile proxies such as AnyIP to be able to manage more accounts in future

**Focus**

  * Youâ€™ll participate directly in AI and virtual companion discussions.
  * Comments should add real value, avoid links, and blend naturally into ongoing conversations.

**Goal**

Help each account build a visible, trusted presence in relevant subreddits.

The long-term objective is strong credibility and community familiarity, not
spam or promotion.

**Bonus skills**

  * Experience growing or managing your own subreddit.
  * Building community on subreddit.

**How to apply:**

  * use the Google Form, the main evaluator will be the video recording, don't apply if you won't do video application
  * Record a 3â€“5 minute Loom video with your camera on, showing the screen **( show not tell)**.

In the video, you'll need to cover:

  1. Show/tell what tangible results youâ€™ve got with Reddit for a company?
  2. Show how you write comments, how you ensure you dont get downvoted as spammer/promoter.
  3. Share what tools you use for Reddit to track keywords/mentions and what you do to not get banned?

Apply in the google form: https://forms.gle/Bwigvz1xofhk8rHy5

* * *

Your job is to execute our content strategy that is aligned with our company-
wide growth goals by creating high-quality Youtube videos and then repurposing
these into other content formats with AI automations (we have these already
set up).

You will be working with freelance editors, so your job is mostly about
researching, scripting, filming, and overseeing the production, distribution
and repurposing process of the content.

* * *

Detailed Requirements
---------------------

We are currently looking for a **front-end engineer** to develop the **chart module**. Below are the detailed requirements:

1.  Our product's web front-end is written using **Svelte 5** / **TypeScript**. It would be great if you are already familiar with the details of Svelte 5 development. If not, please ensure you have experience developing products with React/Vue to quickly learn and get up to speed.
    
2.  We currently use **ECharts** as our chart library. Candidates with relevant experience are preferred.
    
3.  The chart module involves database queries and the generation and transformation of SQL queries. Candidates with experience in **DuckDB / PostgreSQL / BigQuery** are preferred.
    
4.  Although this chart module is a new feature, its data flow still involves existing functional modules. Therefore, you will still need to learn and understand the existing code (App web front-end code, as well as code and protocols synchronized with the backend).
    
5.  For this position, it needs to create a new data model for charts, based on the existing Table data model and file/data structure, to store, synchronize, and render user data on charts. And writing the relevant technical documentation are also part of this position.
    
6.  Candidates need to have passion for developing BI / data analysis software. (Otherwise, daily work can become boring)
    
7.  Candidates who effectively use AI development / code review tools are preferred.
    
8.  Other basic web front-end requirements: basic knowledge and concepts of HTML5/CSS/DOM, and fundamental computer algorithm knowledge.

Your job is to execute our content strategy that is aligned with our company-
wide growth goals by creating high-quality Youtube videos and then repurposing
these into other content formats with AI automations (we have these already
set up).

You will be working with freelance editors, so your job is mostly about
researching, scripting, filming, and overseeing the production, distribution
and repurposing process of the content.

* * *

We are seeking a Front-End Developer to design and build the user-facing
components of our high-performance trading platform. You will play a key role
in creating intuitive, data-rich interfaces that enable traders and analysts
to work efficiently and effectively.

You will collaborate closely with the Back-End Development Team and the
Project Manager to deliver seamless, integrated systems. A key factor is the
front end developerâ€™s ability to deeply discuss approaches, trade-offs,
limitations, and pros/cons with the development team, rather than reliance on
any specific pattern or library.

****

**Key Responsibilities**

  * Develop and maintain the front-end applications of our trading platform.
  * Collaborate with back-end developers and the project manager to ensure smooth integration across systems.
  * Design and implement multi-page layouts, menus, and workflows that balance usability with efficiency.
  * Contribute to the design and user experience of the trading platform, performance & risk manager, and backtesting engine.
  * Implement and optimize charting and data visualization features, leveraging libraries such as TradingView or D3.js to support a wide variety of chart types (tables, multi-line chart packs, etc.).
  * Continuously refine the UI/UX to ensure clarity, speed, and intuitive navigation for end users.

****

**Qualifications**

  * Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with developers, project managers, and business stakeholders.
  * A keen eye for design, simplicity, and efficiency, with the ability to translate complex requirements into clean, user-friendly interfaces.
  * Knowledge of financial systems or trading concepts is preferred.

****

**Core stack (mandatory)**

  * React 18 + Next.js (App Router), TypeScript, TailwindCSS.
  * Strong command of state management for high-frequency data (e.g., Zustand, Redux Toolkit, useSyncExternalStore).

****

**Real-time data & performance**

  * Hands-on with WebSockets / SSE and reconnection/backoff strategies; handling authenticated socket connections and topic resubscriptions.
  * Experience implementing backpressure, buffering, coalescing, and windowing to prevent UI thrash under thousands of updates/minute.
  * Data virtualization (react-virtualized, react-window) for large tables (orders, positions, trades).
  * Familiar with Web Workers / OffscreenCanvas and message passing to keep the main thread responsive.
  * Awareness of latency budgets and frame-time profiling using React DevTools and browser performance tools.

****

**Charting & visualization**

  * Practical experience with professional charting libs (e.g., TradingView Charting Library, Lightweight Charts, Highcharts, D3).
  * Real-time overlays: best bid/ask, order book depth, last OHLCV, order/position annotations.
  * Multi-pane layouts (price, volume, indicators) with synchronized crosshairs and time scales.

****

**Architecture & data access**

  * Client-side caching and invalidation (e.g., TanStack Query / React Query).
  * Schema-driven UI for instruments and venues.
  * Use of Error Boundaries, Suspense, and progressive hydration/streaming for large Next.js pages.

****

**Auth, security, and roles**

  * Strong understanding of OIDC/JWT flows, token refresh/rotation, and WebSocket authentication.
  * Role-based feature gating (read-only vs trading permissio

****

**Testing, quality, and reliability**

  * Unit tests for critical transforms/parsers (e.g., Playwright/Vitest for E2E/interaction flows)
  * Experience with feature flags, staged rollouts, and monitoring with Sentry/OpenTelemetry.

****

**Nice-to-haves**

  * Experience with desktop-class layouts (drag-to-dock panels, resizable grids).
  * Exposure to WASM for heavy computations (e.g., indicator calculations).
  * Familiarity with FIX/crypto venue nuances (tick sizes, lot sizes, trading sessions).

**Role Details**

  * **Type:** Full-Time
  * **Location:** Remote
  * **Engagement:** Ongoing collaboration with a small, fast-moving development team
  * **Compensation:** Competitive; based on experience

* * *

postTitle: Named Account Executive, US-West [IC5] at Sourcegraph
jobTitle: Named Account Executive, US-West [IC5] at Sourcegraph
descContent:
### Who we are

Everything is changing in how software gets built, and Sourcegraph Code Search
is at the center of that transformation. Code Search is the worldâ€™s most
powerful code search engine, helping developers explore, understand, and
navigate massive, complex codebases with speed and confidence.

Our mission at Sourcegraph is to make it so that everyone can code - not just
~0.1% of the population. Software touches everything, but the ability to build
it is still limited to a few. Weâ€™re here to change that.

Teams at companies like Stripe, Uber, and Palo Alto Networks rely on
Sourcegraph to ship faster and with higher quality. Weâ€™re backed by a16z,
Sequoia, and Redpoint, and proud to operate as a globally distributed team
that values high agency, direct communication, and a deep love for developers
and their craft.

If you want to help expand who gets to build software - and contribute to
infrastructure that empowers millions of developers to do their best work -
**join us.**

###  Working hours

ğŸŒ While we are an all-remote company and hire [almost
anywhere](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/How-we-engage-talent-outside-of-the-
US-218f7193695a46cbb1ef39ef9c1f72d4) in the world, we do require successful
candidates to be located in the United States, specifically on the West Coast.

Preferred location:

  * USA - West

### Why this job is exciting

This is a first-of-its-kind role at Sourcegraph, purpose-built for sellers who
thrive on deepening relationships and maximizing value within the world's most
sophisticated engineering organizations. You'll own a book of named accounts,
partnering with teams at companies transforming industries through software.
If you're energized by strategic account growth over net-new prospecting, this
is your opportunity to build something new.

Hereâ€™s what you can expect in your first year:

**ğŸ“… Within one month, you willâ€¦**

  * Complete new hire onboarding with the support of your manager and onboarding buddy
  * Immerse yourself in Sourcegraph's products and value proposition
  * Meet your cross-functional partners (CSM, Support, Solutions Engineering, Professional Services)
  * Begin to learn your named book

**ğŸ“… Within three months, you willâ€¦**

  * Establish executive relationships within your accounts
  * Identify expansion opportunities across business units
  * Run your first cross-functional account strategy sessions
  * Begin prospecting into new teams within existing customer footprints

**ğŸ“… Within six months, you willâ€¦**

  * Drive measurable expansion revenue
  * Develop repeatable playbooks for multi-threading into new teams within accounts
  * Become a trusted advisor to your customers' engineering leadership
  * Consistently hit retention and expansion targets

**ğŸ“… Within one year, you willâ€¦**

  * Be recognized as a top performer in account retention and growth
  * Contribute to refining the Named AE motion and mentor future hires as this team scales

### About you

You are a relationship-driven seller who thrives on nurturing and growing a
strategic book of business. You take full accountability for your accounts
building cohesive strategies, nurturing executive relationships, and
orchestrating cross-functional teams to drive customer outcomes.

You're not looking to chase net-new logos; you're energized by going deep,
expanding footprints, and becoming a trusted partner to engineering leaders at
complex organizations.

**Your Skills and Experience:**

  * 7+ years of B2B SaaS sales experience with a focus on account management, renewals & expansion, or farming motions
  * Proven track record of retaining and growing enterprise accounts
  * Demonstrated ability to build and maintain executive-level relationships (VP+)
  * Experience collaborating cross-functionally with CSM, Sales Eng, Support, and PS teams to drive customer outcomes
  * Strong account planning and strategic thinking skills
  * Comfortable navigating complex, multi-stakeholder environments

**Nice to Haves:**

  * Experience selling to developers or engineering teams
  * Familiarity with developer tools, code search, CI/CD, or DevOps concepts
  * Background in consumption-based or usage-based pricing models
  * Experience with MEDDPICC or similar sales methodologies

### Level

ğŸ“Š This job is an IC5. You can read more about [our job leveling
philosophy](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Leveling-
Guide-0e1b5c76ada64b9caac387f8b7c4fc66?pvs=4) in our Handbook.

ğŸ‰ **Final Interview Stage** \- we move you to our final round, where you gain

Please note - you are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone
